text: Poured a rich gold with a one-finger white head which left behind lots o’ lacing. The honeyed malts and resinous hops were completely overpowered by dimethyl sulfide.  I’ve had this on tap before with no noticeable DMS, so I’m guessing I just got a skunky bottle.  Flavor was okay despite this - lots of sweet, bready malt lovingly balanced by a grassy hop finish.  Mouthfeel is light and refreshing.  One of my favorite lagers and always a nice change of pace.
poured a gold color with a small white head.  very malty in aroma nice balance of malts and hops.  enjoyed this and would get it again

UPDATED: AUG 28, 2008 12 oz bottle.  Poured a very clear gold color with a one finger white head.  Aroma is all malt, but very clean.  This beer is very true to its style.  Very earthy taste.  Great Dortmunder style beer.  Good for the summer.
On tap in a sampler at GLB in Cleveland. A smooth lager, a bit corny. No real hop flavor. Mrs. Arnie said it reminder her of mash right from the kettle, "too yeasty." I kinda liked that.

Great Lakes Sample Pack from Woodmans Oak Creek. 
Aroma is very malty with some honey and caramel notes.. Flavor is slightly buttery, very smooth., very drinkable. Overalll, a very, very good beer, espiecially for the style

UPDATED: DEC 13, 2012 A deliciously refreshing beer that Ive long dug. Very pure golden color with a lasting effervescence and a decent head too. Crisp hops in the aroma, with enough flavorful malts to balance. Not too bready, thankfully, with citrus and honey balancing things. Nice one.

Bottle.  Pours a translucent copper with a bunch of golden notes and a medium bubbly/creamy off white head that laced.    Aroma of a nice bready, lightly sweet malt, noble hops, lightly spicy hop notes,  and a touch of citrus.  Flavor of the same breast/lightly sweet malt, touch of toasted grains, lemon and a nice amount of noble hop flavor.  Very well done.

Poured a dark gold.  Spicey sweet aroma.  Light medium body, doughy, the hop character is what makes this one worth while.  It’s not often I enjoy a lager, this one is pretty good.  Other lager producers should try and copy.
user_location: from Michigan now in Charlotte, North Carolina, USA

text: Pours a bright deep golden color with a substatial thick white head.  Sweet malt, maple and spice aroma.  Rich caramely sweet toasted malt flavor with some hop grassiness and mild bitterness.  Excellent, but not entirely Dort-like.

Thanks to Crizay for this nice lager.  Pours gold to an almost orange color with a moderate white head fading to a nice ring.  Aroma is definitely grassy, but it’s more than that.  There’s a slight citrus rind to it, but the grainy smell is so direct, it’s like I can smell the handful of grain right there.  It’s like rye bread crust.  Taste has the pungent grassy and earth flavor of a pilsner combined with the real subtle toasty toffee note of an O-fest (kinda like how the label says), and it finishes with a fairly distinct caramel flavor.  Buttered toast finishes it out with that rye breadcrust flavor providing a nice aftertaste.  Mouthfeel is light and drinkable but it’s as involved and smooth as you can possibly get in the style.  Great lager here.  Have this as the first beer of the night to be sure you notice it all.

On tap at Fries Cafe.
Pours a light gold in color with just a slight head forming on the pour.  It’s quickly gone after receiving my beer.  Smell is very "lagerish", but surprisingly with some nice piney hops.  Taste is more of those nice hops.  I’m not a big lager fan, but the hop flavor in this one really let me enjoy this beer.  Clean and smooth on the taste.  Good beer.

UPDATED: MAY 13, 2011 12oz bottle and later draft pours,  pours clear golden with white head. aroma is biscuity, cookie, earthy. flavor is earthy, biscuity, mildly sweet, cookie finish. tasty, a bit heavy, and could use a bit more hops for crisp feel and balance.

Aroma is very malty with some honey  and caramel notes.  This beer is fairly clear, although I havs seen clearer, a dark golden color.  Flavor is slightly buttery, very smooth.  Very slight taste of vegetables, probably from adjuncts.  Palate is good, very drinkable.  Overalll, a very, very good beer, espiecially for the style.  I would definitely buy this if I could get it on a regular basis.
Bottle.  Poured a medium golden color with minimal off-white head.   Aroma was a bit malty.   Flavor was just a touch sweet, malty, and hoppy on the back end.   It was OK.

I really enjoy this beer.  I’ve had it probably 50 times but only now am I rating it.  Not particularly a fan of the lagers including dortmunders but this beer is consistently delicious.  Great full body with a nnice malty flavor balanced out beautifully by a noticeable hop presence.  Great beer with food.
Pours a beautiful golden color and slightly hoppy aroma with a foamy, but short-lived head.  Has a smooth malty flavor with a sharper, hoppier finish.

Bottle. Brilliant gold color wioth a nice white head that stayed a while. Pretty good hop aroma slightly overshadowing the malt aroma. Clean, crisp flavor of malt just slightly overshadowed by the hop bitterness and flavor. Good mouthfeel; not too heavy but, not too thin either. Very drinkable. A very tasty lager.

Pours golden color with nice frothy white head. Has a nice crisp malty aroma. Nice malt based flavor with some very nice notes of fruit and honey, eventually fading into a light hop bitterness that balances out this great beer. By far the best beer Ive had in this style.
Golden color......fluffy head.  Malty aroma, with a few bitter notes.  Solid malt flavor up front......somewhat of a crisp mouthfeel.  Slight hop bitterness in the back, with a very dry finish.

I dont usually make a habit of drinking light lagers, but being that this is Great Lakes, I do tend to have one periodically.  This beer, when fresh, is a session drinkers dream.  Light, crisp, with a very flavorful, malty body, Dortmunder finishes clean with a nice hop presence.  This beer is comparable to Sam Adams Boston Lager, and the both of them, when fresh can hang with me anytime.

Bottle.  Pours clear gold, medium white head with good lacing.  Aroma of wheat, some spice,  and something sweet that I cant put my finger on.  Taste is malty, nice and crisp, slight hint of bitterness.  Really easy drinking, I could down a 6 in no time.  Great summer brew.  Good stuff.

Presentation: It was poured from a 12oz bottle into a pint glass. The color is a beautifully bright and golden with great clarity. Its head has great retention and builds up thick and creamy white. Lots of cool lacing is left behind on the glass. The aroma is full of fruity sweet malts and aromatic floral hops. The flavor and body are wonderfully balanced. The malt has a pleasant sweet fruity character offset by flavorful leafy and crisp citrus hops with mild bitterness that quickly fades into the finish. The body is light to medium with a smooth yet crisp texture that is perfectly balanced with carbonation. It is just darn good and very drinkable.

Pours a gorgeous, hazed sunny blonde capped with clean foamy white.  Sweet aroma of honey, pear, apple cider vinegar.  Pilsener malts.  An odd, dusty pungency of paprika and ground mace washes over pretty heavily, but this isnt really displeasing.  Just weird.  Dry spice and chewy caramel flavor chased by a refreshing pear skin-like bitterness.  Further notes of white toast, honey dipped apples, cotton candy; a vague fruit suggestion seems acerbic but doesnt give much distinct flavor.  Peculiar characteristics are sufficiently reined in by a basic, crisp, crackery malt character thats surprisingly firm.  Recurrent hints of orange rind.  Sprightly, medium body tending to seem thick; lengthy, bittersweet finish of fresh grass and floral honey.  The body seems overly heavy and doesnt highlight the beers strengths, but its refreshing anyway.  Thanks Bill!

Poured attractive clear dark golden color with generous white head that lingered a while.  Aroma was a pleasant balanced of malt and hops.  Flavor was nicely malty with a good hop presence as well.  Slightly sweet.  Excellent session beer that I look forward to enjoying more of. Very refreshing.

12 oz bottle.  (bb 08/04/08).  A lovely copper-coloured beer with a thin, quickly disappearing head.  Malty (pilsner) aroma with some earthiness and a touch of hops.  The (slightly sweet, slightly grainy) malt is right up front in this beer.  Nice hops at the end for balance.  Carbonation and body are medium to high.  I didnt expect much form this one, as Im not a big fan of the style, but I really liked it.
Pours clear, yellow, with a fine, white head. Aroma is rather hoppy with a pleasant, grassy malt backdrop. Moderate mouthfeel with an excellent hop flavor. Great beer!
nice straw yellow pour rich malty sweet flavor with a little hop presnence good balance nicely done lager
clear and golden with solid white head.  flavor of some munich and pale malt, an overall nice malt flavor.  the finish is dry with a sharp hop flavor.  nice
Good session beer.  Thanks Matt.  Reminds me of the mild yet real taste of a Boston Lager from Sam Adams with a bit more character.

tonight, i drank this out of the bottle.  there will be no glassware tonight.  two mutual friends helped me discover this beverage.  as i take residency in ohio for the next two weeks, ill be sure to use my credit card to purchase more and more and more of this beer, in spite of the fact that i cant afford to drink it.  this beer is right down the middle, and i love and respect you.  obama 2008.
Pours a copper-orange foamy head. Aroma is sweet, malty and cirtusy. Flavor is floral. A bit of hoppy bitterness. Still a bit of citrus flavor. Not too bad.

Amber colour, medium body, nice finger sized white head, and even a little lacing that runs down the glass in each sip. bubbles that rise steadily from bottom to top like clockwork. really nice beer, soft hoppy charachter that hits the top of the roof of your mouth every time.
Great lacing! On tap at great lakes. Golden, thick white head. crisp beer. Heavy malt and hop balenced on my palate.
A typical dortmunder. Medium body, not really hoppy, slightly citric. Enjoyable but nothing to writhe home about
Pours gold with frothy head that laces the glass beautifully.  The aroma is bready with a touch of yeast.  This beer is a nice balance between malt and hop.  Very enjoyable.
Bottle from Canals. Golden/copper pour with a yeasty aroma and hints of citrus and spice. Bready citrus taste that has a spicey crisp finish. Pretty good.

Sample at West Lakeview Liquors, Chicago, Great Lakes Tasting.  Golden color with small white head.  Aroma is very dry malt with lager yeast and noble hops.  Flavor is very much off-dry pilsner malt with some orange.  Medium to thin body with good carbonation.  Another well balanced beer from Great Lakes.
A solid beer from Great Lakes.  Not my favorite style, but very well done for what it is.  Pours gold with a white head.  Light aroma.  Nice bitterness to go along with the malt.

this stuff is legit, i think its great lakes more popular beer.  its kind of expensive at a bar, but its more costly for a reason.  its bitter in taste and its got more alcohol per volume.  i like it.

POured a golden orangish color with a white head. Aroma of light malts and a small amount of hops. Flavor is also nice malty backboen with a blend of hops. Not the greatest beer, but excellent for the style.

Pretty good overall representation of this style of beer, which is admittedly not my favorite.  Pours the color of a good solid oak table, with golden hints of orange.  White head.  Grainy-Cheerios smell, light honey, with a rich yeasty flavor that stays on your tongue.  Very crisp and smooth, hides its alcohol well.  Dont hate me for saying it tastes damn good with some Guinness floated on top of it.

text: Totally average brew. Looks like a lager, tastes like a lager with malt and spice. Just some weird tastes going on here. Slightly bitter and spicey. Drinks clean and easy, but the odd tastes get in the way.

Bottle:  Pours a clear gold color with a min. white head.  Nose is of pale malts, orange rind and some subtle hop notes.  Very crisp and clean tasting...flavor hints at some earthy hop tones and light malts.  Pretty good.

Good solid tasting brew with sort of a chunky body.  Not as smooth or clean drinking that I like, but rich in flavor and generally I believe is best as a beer to have with food.  Good with seafood or some grill fare.
Bottle pours a clear golden color with a white head.  Head does not last long.  Has a very slight hop aroma with a slight sweet lager like smell.  Taste has mostly malt flavors with crisp finish.

Pours a clear golden color with a 1.5 finger foamy white head.  The aroma is a sort of dry bready character with some grassy hop notes.  The flavor is very similar to a pils, but with a lot of caramel character.  Very crisp and clean tasting.  Medium bodied.  Sort of a dry finish, but doesnt leave much flavor on the palate.

Another bottle courtesy of fiver29.  Pours a clear amber color with one finger head.  Really nice lacing on this one.  Nose is floral, fresh cut grass, spice, bread and light hops.  Palate is sweet malt and honey with a mild hop finish.  Medium mouth feel.  I like it - tasty lager.  Thanks again John!

bottle: pours a great clean golden colour with a small saop .like thin head. plenty of carbonation. good aroma of  toasted grarins and fruity esters. nice bready aroam also. very nice.
flavour is starts as a good hop bitterness fades into some nice grain flavours that are a good bread, some sweetness comes through along with a little caramel. finishes great with some dry bitterness . great beer.

Pours clear golden amber with no bubbles and a large frothy white head. Aroma of soggy sourdough bread-crust. Mmm that is pretty good... glad it is on the bready side or I would be disappointed.  Clean and bold bitter American? hops, sour breadiness, some bubble-gum and a dry finish.  Smooth flat body.   Weihenstephaner still wins though =p

Pours a clear, golden amber.....light head. Light malty aroma...not really any hops present. Caramel presence in the flavor...general sweetness dominates. Simila to pilsner-type beers. Not bad, but nothing really stands out with this beer.

Thanks to goryshkewych for this great extra 
Bottle poured clear golden yellow with a small whit head that turns into a ring around the glass

Nice clean malt and hops aroma filled my nose

The taste is great, malts and a nice bit of hops. Clean on the palette with enough carbonation to make it crisp as well 

Very drinkable could easily do a quite a few of these of these. a great lager that I wouldnt mind drinking again
Gold/copper with fluffy white head.  Biscuit, grain, hops, earthy notes, sweet dough.  This is one drinkable, well made brew.  Quite nice.

Fluffy white head sits atop a light coppered colored body.  Wonderful aroma of cookie and caramel laced with spicy and earthy hops.   Bready, doughy sweet flavor, with spicy/earthy hops presense that really comes on in the finish.  Body heavier than I expected.  Now that this is available in NY, it is a staple in my fridge.
Golden pour with a moderate foamy head.  Aroma is malty with a floral note.  Nice easy drink.  Sharp clean finish.

thanks to miketd.
Nice golden pur with a foamy white head. biscuit malty, refreshing clean finish. Nice beer.
From Lone Hill.  Clear golden with a fizzy white head.  Sweet malty slightly spicy aroma and taste.
Nice golden brew, I enjoyed the flavor of it well. It was accurate to the style while retaining smooth drinkable charateristics
Pale yellow with thin white head.  Mild sour aroma with a little caramel sweetness.  Tastes pretty smooth & balanced with a nice sweet start & mild bitter finish.

Gold colored brew with a fizzy head. Aroma of bread, biscuit, and spicy hops. The flavor is that of moderately sweet bread with grassy, spicy, citrus hops. The hops border on bitter, but are more clean and crisp. I like this brew.

Bottle, pours a nice dark gold color with a white tan head that lasts nicely. A light to medium malt aroma some straw, a bit of spice, citrus hops smells american rather than german. Nice mouthfeel and a nice a slight sweet light carmel taste, with a touch of citrus hops not very german perhaps english or american. A Nice brew.

Dark yellow color, see through with no cloud. Frothy, thick head lasts about 30-45 seconds. Smells very hoppy however the hops dont really carry through to the taste. Has a slight citrus flavor. Light on the palate and very smooth. Little to no aftertaste. I was expecting more from this beer.

Poured to create a nice head that lasts for quite a bit of time and leaves great lacing on the drinking glass.  Great straw color.  Aroma is very mild of hops and malt.  Taste is sweet, malty and very crisp .  Great beer.
A nice brew, had as a draft.  Is smooth and mildly weighted beer.  Goes well with a meal, but overall doesnt really stand out very much

Light amber body with a decent, white head. Interesting, Swiss cheese-llike lacing. The aroma is quite bready, yeasty even. The flavor seems suit, and here I will make reference to Swiss cheese, again. Yes, those notes can be found in the flavor, and Im thankful a previous rater brought that to my attention. Good carbonation, and the general mouthfeel is about medium in weight. Overall, this is a good beer, and I have a feeling it would pair nicely with a number of different foods.

Very good beer. Goes great on a cold night with  a turkey sandwich on rye.  I think one would not be dissapponted with this one. Hearty substance, great appearance, nice lacing, everything a Dort should be.

Thee best Dortmunder you will find outside of ...... And then again maybe its even better subjectively speaking ...
Love this stuff, feel lucky to be able to get it in plentiful supply here in Pittsburgh ... Cleveland is only 2 hours drive away .
Thanks Great Lakes !
Beat yer painter !
Oh, and did I say : THIS IS PERHAPS THE PERFECT/IDEAL SESSION BREW !!!

Ive held off a long time from rating this beer, simply because I wanted to try it on tap (I think a beer like this isnt the same in the bottle) - so I got it on tap at the Winking Lizard in Cleveland (and again at the airport while waiting for my plane), and Im really glad I did - this strikes a perfect match between assertive european hops and buttery, bready, almost nutty flavors - some mild spiciness and bright fruity character - very clean, but full enough to keep it from being thin - I would drink this all day long.

Bottle in my Grandmothers favorite beer glass.  A little on the cold sideNice golden honey color and nice head.  Modest hop odor with a very nice balance of malt and hops.  Modest buttery taste , spicies, with dry hops finish.  Really nice balance.
Very drinkable lager. Give one of theese to your friends that love miller or one of thoose others. IT would be a nice introduction to craft brews.

Lets get one thing straight, folks, I am a Dortmunder Export Snob. Its a bold statement, I know, but I just want everyone to know I wont be pulling any punches on this review.

Appearance: Pours a light copper body with a full, lathery white head.

Smell: Bready pilsner malt aroma with a bit of orange zest and spicy, floral hop scents.

Taste: Clean pils malt flavor with a light sweetness, a bit of breadiness, and a slight, subtle hint of juicy orange peel. Flowery, spiced hop flavors with a mild bitterness. Touch of yeast. Drying, crispy finish.

Mouthfeel: Medium-thin body. Light, spritzy carbonation.

Drinkability: A very nice, easy drinking Dortmunder. Id say I would have it around regulary, but Great Lakes beers are regrettably unavailable in my state.

UPDATED: FEB 18, 2008 Bottle and Tap. Absolutely delightful lager (yes, I said delightful). Rich and full of flavor; the beer pours out golden with an amber hugh. If you are ever presented with an opportunity to try this, take it; you will not be sorry.
Sampled at Food and Froth.  Crisp, smooth, and almost perfectly balanced.  Very sessionable.
Brought by a friend from Cleveland. One of the better lager style beers available. If it was available to me I might just make it my summer session beer of choice.

Bottle. Pours clear amber with a big fluffy white head. Sweet malty aroma with caramel, apricot and bread. Medium body, very smooth. Big malt flavor, notes of caramel and toast. Very well balanced and enjoyable.

Courtesy of Hoppymeal, thanks Derek! Pours a golden color with a medium foaming offwhite head. Aroma of malts and light citrus. Initial taste is crisp with a light to medium body. Moving into a nutty maltiness,wheat and a splash bitter hops. Tangy hops on the midpalate and finish with light spices. Great palate duration and enjoyable. Light but flavorable. Some head retention and lacing of the glass.

12 oz bottle.  Pours copper with a 1 cm foamy off white head.  Aroma is mostly malts, some lemon and some strange nut or woodiness.  Initial flavor is covered by the malts, ends with hops and spice.  Some decent lacing, noted carbonation, light on alcohol.  Light to medium mouthfeel but adequate for the style.  Drinkable and one of the better options from GL.

Bottle "enjoy by" 2/23/08. Clear golden brew with nice white head. I didnt detect a lot of aroma from this. Body is perhaps on the light side of medium, with crisp carbonation. Bready malts with hops nicely balanced in. The finish isnt completely dry, and has some graininess to it. A cousin of US macro lagers, but much tastier. I probably would enjoy it even more in summer, but it isnt merely a lawnmower beer.

April 2006 - Rating this according to style, this is incredible. Didnt realize I forgot to rate this, but this is one incredible smooth, rich, full tasting beer. #1 in style for a reason...dont pass by because it is a "standard" brew.

Pours a pale gold, light head.  Aroma is malty, a bit nutty, with hints of light citrus.  Taste is hoppy with a roasty sweetness to it (if that makes any sense).  A bitterness lingers briefly, but the finish is relatively clean and feels crisp on the palate.  Not the most complex dort and certainly not the best offering by GLB, but not a bad drink.  Locally, this is available on tap in anything above a dive bar and is certainly miles ahead of the typical draught offerings.
Medium golden color, frothy white head. A mostly malty nose with hints of mildly roasted grain and faint citrus. Light bodied and easily drinkable. Finishes short and clean.

(Bottle) Pours a clear golden color with only a small amount of head. The aroma is muted, and includes some grain and toffee. Taste includes a good amount of hops. Sweet notes as well. Although this was quite good for the style, it was lacking in originality.

The gold dortmunder pours a apricot bronze with a decent head and good lacing but doesnt hide its alcohol presence well and isnt as perfectly balanced as the commercial description would have you believe.  Still, a good example of a drinkable style of this central German style.

This is not the most complex beer in the shed, nor the most exciting, but its better than a lager, and fuller.  Very round flavors of wheat, almost grainy like oatmeal, but with slight honey and sweetness.  This beer is genius because you could easily get your big dumb friends hooked on it instead of Bud or Miller, then after a few months say "Hey, try this Blackout Stout.  Its by the people who do the Dortmunder Gold."  After a couple of those theyll be drinking real beer.

Bottle.  Please enjoy by:  02/18/08.  A pale copper pour with a one finger-thick light-tan head.  Caramel, brown sugar and sweet corn in the aroma.  Medium-bodied and excellent balance.  Nicely crisp and clean-tasting.  Sweet caramel and brown sugar flavors upfront.  A somewhat dry, roasty, grainy bitterness at the end with a surprising touch of alcohol in both flavor and warmth.  Solid stuff.

Last of the 6 pack from Binnys (Orland Park, IL). Pours a deep orange tinted gold with a decent white head. Tops in appearance for its style. Light citrus scents, but not much of an aroma. Initial taste a nice malty one with an amount of hops surprising for me. Well balanced. Light and refreshing with a distinct roasty grain aftertaste that slowly becomes a faint bitter. A beer that is tops in its area and a beer Ill buy again.

Pours dark gold with a small white head.  Subtle hint of lemon in the aroma hits me first followed my caramel, some toasted nuts, and slightly doughy.  Peppery, chewy malt flavors with a slight roast character and a hint of lemon.   Theres a little bit of noble hop spice and bitterness that lingers on the tongue after you swallow.  Quite a bit of body for a lager and just the right amount of carbonation to give  a crisp finish.  This is almost the perfect session beer for me.
12 oz bottle from Artusory.  Med carbonation, medium taste.  Not that good, lacks the flavor that I like from other types of beers.

12 oz. bottle.  Poured clear orangish gold with white head that left substantial lacing.  Weak nose with only a trace of bread and yeast evident.  Malty with a dry, slightly bitter finish.  Crisp and easy drinking.  Surprised to see the 5.8% ABV.  Nice offering; difficult for me to rate higher given the styles lack of hops and flavor.
Decent. Pours a golden-orange color with nice lacing that lingers. The aroma and flavor is much more flowery and fresh than typical lagers. Good, but not my favorite beer of the night by a long shot.

Bottle. Pours a clear bubbly golden-orange with an average size lasting fluffy white head. Aromas grassy with a bit of tomato juice, some fruit, yeast and light hops. Somewhat sweet flavour has just a hint of tomato juice along with some sweet fruit, grain, light malt and hops. Average bitter finish. Alcohols hidden. Medium bodied. Im not crazy about this beer, I can drink it and its reasonably well done but I find it just alright.

12 oz. bottle from Secret Santa (Winter 07).  Pour is a clear golden with some orangish under tones.  Nice two inch white head.  Aroma of sweet malt and some bitterness.  Taste is the nice mellow caramel sweet maltiness, with some almost roasted almond nuttiness and bitterness towards the end.  Nice crisp finish, drinkable beer.  Thanks Santa!

Thin off-white head of fine bubbles.  Reduces quickly.  kind of a sickly vegetal aroma with some malts and for whatever strange reason, i am getting apple pie.  Color is a nice dark orange.  Clean and crisp flavor with a good bit of floral hops.  Light bready malts and a late dryness.  Slightly pasty but does not really detract.  Very smooth and easy drinking.  Finishes light malts and sweetness.  A pretty good dortmunder.

An amazing dortmunder.  Great balance between hops and malt.  Has a bit of a breadlike flavor but also contains a nice flowery bouquet of hops that seems content in taking a backseat role.  A great session beer for someone wanting to expand their horizons.

Pours a clean gold/amber color with a thin soapy head.  Aroma is malty, hoppy, caramel, and some citrus fruits.  Taste is lightly malty, with a little citrus, and finishes bitter and hoppy with a hint of almond.
bottle.  straw with slight haze and thin soapy head.  sweet malts, mild apricot adn peach, subdued hops in aroma.  medium body.  mild fruit.  grainy.  nice mild sweet malty body.  mild bitterness.

Bottle thanks to kryptic. Pours a darker than average color for a Helles, but it looks great. Huge white rocky head that dissipates into a thin covering. Champagne-like bubbles are very inviting. Nose of lightly sweet malts and some hops near the end. Flavor is rich and crisp with nice malt and hops. I drank this rather quick...very enjoyable. Thanks kryptic!
Draught at Hop Leaf, ChicagoGolden color; creamy head. Simple aroma, quite malty flavor, a bit crispy.
Not really experienced in this style.  For a lager its great though.  The only other thing close to this style would be Special Export...does that count?

Light aroma with some sweetness and a touch of hops. Pours a transparent gold with a small white head. Lightly sweet up front with some caramel with some light hops in the finish. Did not find this all that flavorful. Cames across to me as if they added some light hops in the finish of a Euro-lager.

12oz bottle-pours a foamy disappearing off white head and gold color.  Aroma is musty, somewhat sweet medium malt.  Taste is musty, somewhat sweet medium malt, secondary earthy/spicy hops.  OK carbonation.  Thanks E Notch for bringing this one back.
On tap,  Poured a golden brown hue with no head.  Aroma was a mix of caramel and toast.  Flavor was moderately sweet with a crisp finish.  Well balanced and easy to drink.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of a trade with DeuceDeuceOU.  Pours a brilliant clear gold with a moderate white head that lasted through most of the glass and partially coated the glass.  Light but pleasant floral aroma along with a little bit of malt.  The malt and hops come through more in the flavor, especially the hops.  Medium bitterness at the finish.  Not my favorite style, but not a bad representation either.

This lager poured a dark yellow colour with not much of a foamy off white head. Scents included eggs, earth, sweet malt and grass. First taste had a off flavour with more eggs on the palate. Slightly watery but flavours of corn syrup and hop did come through at the end. The finish is slightly hoppy and sourish. I think I could have gained a fresher bottle.

Thanks to Dankman for the bottle!  Pours slighty hazy shade of gold.  White fizzy head with light lacing. Hoppy aroma with malty backbone. slighty bitter finish as hops are mentionable, very sessionable beer
Pours out a nice golden/dark straw color with a nice white head. Malty aroma with slight grass. Very drinkable, malty with slight grassy hop presence, slightly dry finish. Solid, thanks to Santa
Comlex arom aof hops and malt. Malty flavor with some hop biotterness for balance, very well made, some carmel evident an well as a touch of citrus.  dry finish.One of my favorite beers

12oz bottle.  Aroma is fantastic, floral, citrus, peach, and a little sweet malt.  Average sized white head that mostly lasted and left great lacing.  Gold amber hue.  Flavor is great as well.  Good malt that finishes a little bitter.  Palate is smooth and light-medium bodied.  The only thing that detracts is the long finish.  A little bitter after taste that lingered on the roof of my mouth.  Best lager Ive had to date, quite drinkable, highly recommend.
UPDATED: OCT 10, 2007 Bottle. Pours a small white head. Not much aroma, but nice on the palate with a decent balance between malt & hops, just as advertised. Makes a very good session lager.

On tap. Aroma is a little hoppy, some lite sweet scents as well, golden amber pour with white head that sticks around for a bit. Taste is a little bitter with some hint of grain and hops. some slight citrus flavors in there as well. Very smooth and very delicious.

I had read the ratings on this beer and thought Id give it a try.  Kind of disappointing; nothing special.  Seems a little too carbonated for some reason and the taste seems to miss something.  Dont get me wrong...its not a bad beer, but it seems like even though the hops are good, it lacks anything else of substance.  Some time ago I made a homebrew that was very similar to this...I havent made it since.

pours orange with a hint of amber.  A small white head settles into a thin film.  Though the odor is relatively tame, you can detect a hint of hops.  The flavor is very smooth, but subtly complex, ending with a hop aftertaste.  As soon as the beer hits your lips you dont taste it, but the taste gradually builds.  An interesting, slight bitterness makes this beer surprisingly unique.  I really like this beer.

Courtesy of Degarth through Crizay. Thanks gents. 12oz bottle. Light golden orange body with a smallish soapy looking white head, nice retention and decent lacing. Aromas of cereal grains, malts, grass and pine. Flavor doesnt wow me at first, but it grows on you. Sweet grains, orange peels, lemon and earthy notes. Medium bodied, slightly astringent. Oily palate. Finish is piney hops, medium length. I dont love it but its oddly engaging and very drinkable.

My first crack at this style.  Crystal clear, medium golden body with high carbonation.  Large, rocky off-white head.  The head eventually settles to what looks like a patchy cream floater, leaving behind patchy ribbons of intricate lace.  The aroma shows surprisingly strong floral hops, accompanied by pollen, honey, and slightly vinous white fruit.  The flavor is mildly floral and hoppy, with a toasty, biscuit background, a drop of honey and a dash of cream.  Smooth, medium body.  Slightly astringent, peppered honey finish.  Interesting brew.  Very good for a lager.

bottle. aroma of grains and light malt.  malt and moderate bitter flavor. more body than i expected, but it remains crisp, refreshing.  clean finish.  my palate is not refined enough to rate lagers with any efficiency, but this one has a good amount of substance.
really fine beer.  from a 12oz. bottle.  pourd golden with a small white head.  nicely balanced and highly drinkable.  good stuff.

Not sure what it was about drinking beer tonight, but it seems that the beers Ive had so far I wanted to get them by the cases! This was no different. A really easy to drink beer that just gets better and better with each sip. Subtle hops and bright sweet malts crack the aroma and flavor profiles very nicely. Incredibly smooth, crisp with an easy clean finish that leaves a slight bit of residual sweetness hanging around, which I found pleasing. If this was available in California, I know I would have a few cases stocked year round. Great beer.

6 bottles from my bro who visited my other bro in Cleveland.  Pours golden - almost copper with an average head. Hoppy aroma, very nice and the taste matches in hoppyness. Quite delicious. Thanks to my bro for the 6-pack.
very nice aroma of hops, tastes kinda sourish but a smooth chocolate taste too.  It is pretty impressive very good dark beer.

Bottle. Thanks to bullet2urbrain. Pours a deep golden body with nice head. Aroma is pleasant with the typical Helles like feel, light hops. Taste is smooth, crisp, light citrus, slightly bitter. This was pretty enjoyable and may be the best Helles I ever had.
Good thickness and lively hop flavor in this lager. This is a very tasty summer beer and I was quite surprised. It is proof that any style in the hands of a good brewer can be delicious.

12 oz bottle.  Pours a very slightly hazy amber color.  Smells... not very much.  Very very subtle hop aroma, sweet malts, balanced.  Flavor is a little stronger, but still nothing really jumps out to make this a special brew.  Not a bad beer... but not for me.

Had this on draught in St. Charles, Illinois.  Beautiful, reddish golden color with a wispy white head, sweet malts, a bit of grassy hops and caramel in the nose, sweet caramel and maltiness throughout.  Finished clean and strong. This was actually very good.

I love living in Ohio for some of the brewers.

If Im in a bar, and I see no interesting micros from other areas or interesting imports, this is invariably my choice.  Surprisingly full-bodied and flavored for a dortmunder (in my experience).  Flowery nose, with a very strong gold color.  What a macro wishes it looked/smelled like, before even tasting it.  Very sweet/fruity malty taste, very pleasant with food or by itself.  Clean finish, makes it very drinkable.  For being a "flagship" yellow beer, this is quite excellent.  A good standby from Great Lakes.
A good beert for everyday drinking, this is what Budweiser wishes it was and what I wish the run of the mill beer was.
Golden colour with a light head.  Sweet and wheaty smelling.  Slightly sour with grassy undertones.  A nice sweet beer.

An excellent beer withall the qualities a beer should have. Words cannot describe beer made like this one.
If you want an accurate review of this beer, buy some. You wont be sorry.
Very nice, full, dortmunder -- not terribly "hell" however and that I appreciated.  Think Boston Lager with perhaps a bit more subdued hop bitterness.  Could definitely drink more than 1-4 of this.
On tap at the Olympic.  Pours clear golden orange with little carbonation.   A mediocre quality beer much less than I expected.
@ GLBC Beer School, Not bad, but not great, too bubbly and not enough taste for my liking, a quality beer for some, just not enough here. tastewise.

Draft at the brewpub. Yellow body, tiny white head. Oddly fruity aroma is pleasant but unexpected.  Flavour was sweet pale malt, very light bitterness with more fruity hints. Light cider impressions? Average palate is a touch under carbonated. I was underwhelmed.

[376-20070630] Tap @ Great Lakes (Cleveland, OH). Sweet pineapple citrus orange aroma. Clear, golden orange body with a quick foamy white head. Generically grainy flavour with a bit of malt. Medium body. Not bad, repeatable.
Golden with a white head. Slightly sweet malt and some hops.  One of the better lagers I have tried.

Bottle.  Pours a clear copper color with a strong mostly lasting white head.  The aroma is slightly malty with floral notes as well.  The flavor has much of the same but definitely increases in bitterness.  This beer is fairly well balanced.  Medium light body.  Another solid Great Lakes beer.
This beer is trouble. They just go down too easy. Nice golden color. A classic and good quality lager.
xxx not my favorite beer, but good nonetheless, im just not a big fan of the style.

From a 12oz Bottle.  Pours a transparent, deep brassy golden color with a thick layer of fluffy white head.  Rich light malt aroma that reveals notes of cookie dough and fresh bread, highlighted by some floral violet petals and a subtle whiff of herbal hops.  Medium bodied, softly carbonated mouthfeel with a great chewiness without being sticky or sweet.  Wonderfully clean, yet rich maltiness that brings out some creamy cheerios cereal and light toffee.  The carbonation helps lift some of the "weighty" pale malts off the palate, tickling it with a pleasing spice/mild acidity sensation.  This transitions cleanly into a refreshing herbal hops final smack.  Very nice sessionable brew.

12oz bottle, courtesy of artusory.  Thanks, Ryan!  Pours a clear, light golden-orange color; fluffy white head with great lacing.  Pleasant grapey and lightly citrus aroma; sweet and mellow.  Lovely, velvety mouthfeel: some grapes and simple sugar upfront, with a crisp presence of citrus hops mid-palate and some lively effervescence on the tip of the tongue; perfectly sessionable beer.  Quick finish, showing sugar and a light mineral note.  Excellent stuff.

Bottle.  Pours a golden color with white, sticky head.  Leaves a nice lacing around my glass.  Slight aroma.  Nice crisp finish with a flavor that doesnt disappoint.  I can drink these all night long.

smells lagerish and a little bit malty.  appearance is reasonable; dark and heady.  little else in the aroma.  this is a pretty good session, especially for a lager.  it is pretty malty, probably has more taste than most people would want.  i didnt think my rating would end so low, but i cant in good faith raise any of the numbers

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a golden, slight amber color with white head.  Good lacing.  Head sticks around for a bit.  Malty, almost bready aroma..  Nice combination of hop and malt flavors.  Crisp hop start that diminishes to a very sweet, malty finish.  Pretty crisp at the end.  Had to have a this one a second time to get the full effect.  When I had it the first time I really didnt like it.  Im pretty sure its because Ive been on a big IPA/Pale Ale kick.  This is damn good beer though.
Has a very nice deep golden color. At first it tastes heavy and very bitter, but mellows and becomes lighter as I drink on. The finish remains crisp and long lasting throughout.

i gotta admit...this is the first time ive had a dortmunder style. i kinda got what i expected, but i liked it more than i thought i would. im not a huge lager drinker (probably ruined by BMC "lagers") but this was nice. a sweet honey like character along with some breadiness equated to a smooth drinking lager you could enjoy any day, but especially in the coming summer months.

A nice looking pour.  Golden color with a cool looking yellowish head.  Too bad it didnt last long.  Surprisingly strong hop flavor early.  Balance begins to make itself known about half way through the glass and the malt influence grew as the glass warmed.

The aroma is a slight dough smell. The appearance is a clear gold, the head is creamy, off-white, excellent lacing and the head is mostly diminishing. The initial flavor is  a little acidic with a nice bitter that hits the back of the tongue. The finish is average and the bitter stays. The body is light, the texture creamy and the carbonation a slight fizzy.

very very good golden lager.  like $1.75 a bottle here, and well worth it.  to bad i cant get this in 18 packs, or anything bigger than a 6.  i think i could drink these all night.  nice even balanced beer with some more flavor than a usual basic balanced beer.

On tap.  A great beer.  Aroma is subtle, at least as far as I could tell in the bar, but taste was nice and rich, with some raisin sweet undertones, a malty and yeasty body and a crisp finish with a little hop bitter action.  A great beer to drink, well balanced but definitely rich, which I like.
UPDATED: NOV 28, 2007  This beer is so delicious! I dont remember it being this good last time. Its like a good bar drinking session beer should be. Almost a powdery smooth mouthfeel.

Bottle (Thanks WeeHeavySD).  Pours a very clear golden color with a thinnish head.  Aroma is a blend of floral notes with some yeast aceents.  Flavor is malty and slightly hoppy - both very balanced.  Very clean drinking beer.  Nothing offensive.

Rated 2/17/06:  Abundant in my neck of the woods, this beer is on tap at most of the local establishments. When in doubt I order a tall one knowing that I will be easily satisfied. Dortmunder Gold is perhaps the most popular of the Great Lakes Brewing Co.s beers, and for good reason as it is well balanced and chances are your bud light drinking buddy will actually like this. In my opinion this is a great beer overall but I prefer many other beers made by this brewer. Pours a clean copper almost light amber color with a full head that tends to simmer down. Strong carbonation and lacing are always present. The aroma is appealing although very mild for my taste. A slight hop aroma is given off just enough to tickle the nose. The flavor is very good and extremely balanced, the malts and hops seem to be in perfect harmony. The mouthfeel is thicker than I expected which is good and this one finishes as strong as it begins, very refreshing and always a treat.
UPDATED: AUG 20, 2007 its like a lager but much sweeter and with a great finish, the hoppiness comes through along with notes of fruit and caramel

Draft, Cleveland airport. Pours a clear amber with a smallish, trying to hang head. Aroma is inoffensive, and actually sort of nice for a lager - sweetish malty. Taste is not bad either. Body is light medium with a slightly dryish palate. Slight sour and refreshing dry note on finish is nice.

Murky golden in colour, lingering white coloured head, no lacing.  The aroma is of cookie and bready malts, very light caramel sweetness, some apples.  The flavour is a bit stale, pale malts, bready, herbal and grassy.  Mildly bitter mouthfeel, medium/light body, medium carbonation.  Finishes fairly quick, watery, lightly bitter.  This is way past its prime Im afraid.
355ml bottle shared by <a
href=http://www.ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?U target=blank>beerhugger, thanks Steve.
Best before May 24, 2005.

Clear amber/gold, thin white head. Lightly spicy aroma, something like what you might find in a Heineken. Tastes okay, but nothing exciting. Some hops, slightly metallic. Not strictly bad, but does little to dispel the perception that lagers are boring.

this is a beer you give to friends who drink typical mass marketed american lagers in order to introduce them to a far superior product that is not too far from what they are used to. well made lager, interesting sweetness balanced well with a crisp hop finish. Great brewery.

sample at the Chicago Green Fest.  Im new at this beer rating stuff, but of all the beers I ever had I would rate this as one of the best.  Excellent balance! with a smooth finish, what more could you want.  If taste is the messure, this beer has a great future in the Illinois, wisconsin, Minnesota market.
This was an excellent dortmunder. It had a smooth taste and the aftertaste was not bitter like other darker beers. Overall this is a quality beer.
Clear golden amber body with a fluffy white head.  Mild aroma of sweet caramel malt.  Well balanced taste... tangy hoppiness and sweet maltiness.

UPDATED: MAY 21, 2010 Bottle. Deep gold body. Frothy white head, mostly diminishing. Aroma of toasted bread, toasted grain, cookie, herbs and flowers. The flavor is moderately sweet, lightly bitter and lightly acidic. It finishes lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter and lightly acidic. Medium body, watery texture that turns velvety in the finish, lively carbonation. Dortmunder Gold is malt accented as it should be, but hits on the right amount of bitterness and carbonation to balance it and keep it clean. There is a bit of huskiness in the finish, but the fresher the beer, the cleaner it is. Delicious beer.

12 oz bottle from WeeHeavySD. Thanks Jon.  I freely admit that I dig these new school of lagers.  This one is nearly perfect.   Light and refreshing, but a nice hoppiness and maltiness to it.  Something I could drink all day.

Sampled from a 12 oz brown bottle this beer poured a bright dark golden color with a small white head. The aroma was typical sour tangy lager. The flavor was sweet, tangy and had just a hint of fruitiness. The finish was long and tangy.
Pours a nice golden color with a white bubbly head. Short lasting bitter aftertaste with hints of honey in the body. Decent Brew.

Clear amber color with a small head. Aroma of caramel malt and biscuit with a little earthy and grass hops. Moderately sweet and slightly bitter. Light to medium body. Smooth texture. A great session.
Very nice lager.  It has a clear copper color.  The nose is nice with a slight hoppiness.  The taste is a good mix of malty and hoppy.  I could drink this all day.

I tried this while on a business trip in Ohio.  Very smooth and easy to drink, not a very strong aroma, pours a copperish color with a thin head that disolved fairly quick.  A very tiny hint of hops on the after-taste.

12oz bottle.  Pours a light copper color with a white head that disappears pretty quickly.  Not much lace.  Aroma is very unique.  Biscuity and bready.  I am reminded of many foods.  I cant decide if its a good smell or not.  Taste is smooth and crisp, light but refreshing.  The flavor is not astounding but this seems like a nice beer to drink a lot of.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2012 Draft at Jerrys.  Gold with good, creamy, white head /  Nose of light floral, resin, grain, and honey / Medium to full body, fat with low carbonation, but good hopping and balance, and light bitterness on finish / Flavor of violet, bread, honey, and resin / An excellent example of the style.

Draught at Hopleaf. I kind of gave this brew a disadvantage of following two more flavorful beers (Anchor Bock and North Coast PranQster). As such it was quite underwhelming initially. I was deciding whether to get this brew or Allagash White and was immediately regretting the decision. However, as my palate adjusted, the favorable qualities of Dortmunder Gold came out. Basic lageraroma. Completely clear gold with no visible carbonation. Slightly off-white head. No lace. Not much head. Pretty basic. Not as good as Two Brothers Dog Days Dortmunder but a nice Dort nonetheless.

12 oz bottle, my friend Lizs mom brought out to Cali by car all the way from Ohio.  Pours yellowish amber with a big fluffy tan head that peaked over the top of my glass.  The aroma is sweet and light.  Wow, this is a really tasty lager, with a nice spicy edge, that I cant quite put my finger on.  Tasty.

Had this tonight at the new Bennedicts restaurant in Coldwater, MI.  First time I had this as a draft.  Copper color, very smooth.  Overall very nice beer.  Much better then the 6 pack I bought a couple years ago.  I will have again and would recommend to others.

I bought a six pack of this GOLD after reading alot of good reviews on it.   But i must say i really didn,t enjoy it very much . The first one seems OK  but by the 2nd bottle there was an overwheling taste of Honey which i don,t care much for.  For how much i paid for a six pack of this stuff i,d have to rename it FOOLSGOLD.   I don,t mean to sound harsh it,s just not what i was expecting.

The appearance is pristine clear gold with a white head.  The aroma has a smooth maltiness to it that is mimicked in the taste.  Has a light-medium body, is well balanced, and does not end bitter; maybe even a bit watery but in a good way.  This was one of the smoothest brews Ive had.  I could drink this all night an never get bored with it, nor feel bloated.

A perfect compliment to my "gourmet pizza" at a Toledo area restaurant called Capers bar and grill. If you live nearby, its a great spot. Its great to be able to choose a local beer on tap besides the usual macro-brewery beers.

An aroma of light coren. No hard smelll of wet paper int this one. An almost orange pour that clings to the glass almost like thin honey. a flavor of sweet malt and a nice bitter that is short lived but easy to revive for  a minute or tow. A surprising palate that is almost chewy. Carbonation is just a little off.. A surprising all round good beer. I wasnt expecting this much.
Another nice beer from Great Lakes.  This one didnt disappoint one bit.  Really enjoyed the flavor, just the right amount of hops.
I almost thought this was going to be like any other American Lager at first taste, but it balances out nicely and has a touch of hops.  Not bad.  Quite refreshing.  Very sessionable.

GLBC.  Pours a nice ligiht to medium gold and a fluffy sticky pure white head with nice lacing.  Aroma is nice and bready- malty, lightly herbal and noble hops.   Bready doughy flavor with tons of nice fresh pils malt, but cut by the hop bitterness, and slight mineral character- along with a characteristic slight artificial sweetness of many glbc beers.  Pretty damn good though.
Pours gold, it has a nice hop malt balance all the way through.  The finish is hoppier then a real helles from Germany though.
A nice North American version of a dort but a little grainy. Nice malt and hop levels. Page 194 of Michael Jacksons Great Beer Guide only 378 out of 500 Classic Brews to go.
My second beer of this type and what a difference. Tastes like a pale lager with some moderate carbonation. What sets this apart is the strong hop backbone this beer has. Interesting.
user_location: Moon Twp, suburb of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, USA

text: clear gold with a nice white head. good lacing. apple juice aroma. tart sour apple juice with a nice toasted malt back bone hint of bitter grassy hops. bitter medium dry grassy hop finish with some sweet tart apple juice and caramel. medium body. nice. interesting.

12 oz bottle:  A clear golden pour with a large sized white head that lingers.  Aroma is a slight hop aroma with a little bit a spiciness.  Flavor is good for a lager of this type, crisp, clean, and nice and spicy.  Palate is clean and short. Overall, Its pretty good stuff.  Not my favorite style but hell I can appreciate a well crafted beer of any style.  Cheers!
Light malts and some slight hops in the aroma.Pours a light copper with a slight off white head.Sweet malt flavor.Medium mouthfeel with a nice smooth finish.
Pours a clear golden color, good white foam, nice carbonation.  Sharp clear taste, well balanced.  A really good lager.

12 oz bottle. Clear orange color with a white head that laced the glass. Aroma is a mix of molasses, white bread, and a hint of apple. Medium bodied with plenty of bready malt, a touch of caramel, and sprucy hop flavors. Sweet up front, but finishes with subtle acidity.
On tap at local bar. Gold in color, slight head...Slight sweetness, lots of malt...Very easy to drink.

Sparkling dark gold pour with a thick, rocky white head that leaves a web of sticky lacing. Nice bubble action as well - looks elegant in my new Pilseners glasses that I got as a Christmas present. Aroma is fresh and clean with hints of fresh lake water, sweet caramel and a smidgen of nuttiness. Flavor is reminiscent of sweet butter with some essence of cake mix, wisps of honey with a nutty finish. Solidly thick mouthfeel for the style. Overall, a very solid Helles. Thanks to Aurelius for hauling this back from Ohio.
I really enjoy this beer.  One of my favorites.  Wheter on tap at a bar or by bottle I am always impressed with the quality.
A clean light amber color with a faint head. A nice mix of light malts and hops. Decent carbonation. A real easy drinker. Very refreshing. Another good one from Great Lakes.

On tap at the brewery. Pours a clear golden color with a thin white head. Appealing aroma of crisp malt and bread. The flavor is good with its crisp, biscuity malt and bread, delicate and enjoyable. The body is light with a creamy texture and gentle carbonation. This comes as a surprise since I havent found many lagers as good as this in my trips in the US.

Bottle: Orange colored body with thin white head.  Aroma has pine and purfume qualities.  Very attractive, but not very complex.  Carmel malts start this beer, and grow stronger as the beer warms.  Alcohol shows itself in fruity sweetness along with piny, sweet hops in the finish.  Great, full body, like how I always read a dortmunder should have. The finish lingered for quite a while, with some citrus notes added on to the already present alcohol and hop flavors.

Appearance was Clear Gold, poured with thick White Head. Pleasing Aroma of honey and Hops with a Crisp green apple Sweetness taste, Tingly on the tongue. Refreshing. Smooth and refreshing. Easy drinker. First experience with Great Lakes and I have to say it was a good one.

Bottle.   Pours a clear amber color with a medium sized off white head.   Aroma is malt, yeast, some floral hops.   Flavor is sweet malt, some fruity undertones, hops.   Palate is medium, medium carbonation, dry, bitter finish.   Nice example of the style.   A crowd pleaser.
Clear pale amber brew with a sweet malty aroma malty lagers taste, kind of bready but clean and easy to drink. Great every day beer to keep around the house and impress your BMC friends.

I had a couple of these while I was visiting my parents over the Christmas holiday (12/24-25/2006).  Unfortunately, I was under the weather for most of my stay, so I didnt really get to have much beer other than a bottle of two of this and a couple bottles of Leinenkugels Red...

Great Lakes Dortmunder Gold is clear and golden copper in color.  The carbonation is lively which produces a large white head with good retention and some lacing.  The aroma is grassy and floral with some underlying yeasty maltiness.  The flavor is much like the aroma with a pronounced yet well balanced, fresh hop bitterness.  The finish is a hair dry and resfreshingly crisp.  Even though this brew is well carbonated, it is not overdone or fizzy.  It has a slightly less than medium body.

Overall this is a nicely done Dortmunder and is quite memorable.  Kudos to Great Lakes Brewing!  I really like this beer and wish that I could of enjoyed more (I would have had I not been so sick)...

12 oz bottle.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2007 Bought this to bring to the brother in laws for a B-day party. Poured a light copper with a mild head. Not sure what it was about this but I plain just put this half a step above most macros. It was harsh,grainy and semi offensive. My Bro -in Law the MGD guy liked it. That says it all.

Bottle: Copper color with a white head. Aroma, some bready malts, and some grassy hops. Flavor, some yeast, some malts, a nice bit of bitterness. Very refreshing beer. Definitely one of my favorite lagers.

It seems that a brewers "flagship beer" is usually a bit of a crowd pleaser and as a consequence a bit boring compared to its other beers (Unibroues Blanche de Chambly comes to mind as I say this), but this is definitely an exception.  This is a great craft lager.

Color is a light copper color with wonderful head that laces better than any other lager Ive ever had.

Aroma is malty and biscuity, but exceptionally well-balanced with a notable (but in accordance with the style) hop presence.

Taste is refreshing and mild.  Mouthfeel is crisp and refreshing, making this beer highly sessionable.
Very light aroma. Golden color. Different-intriguing flavor. It was tolerable, but not amazing.
this beer was pretty good.  Nothing special like the label and presentation would lead one to be.    BUt decent

Pours a golden amber with two fingers of head.  Aroma is malty and a little hoppy with some fruity undertones.  Taste is smooth and medium bodied of sweet malt, and slightly citrusy hops.  Overally pretty good.

Botlle.12fl.oz

Neat looking amber gold with medium white top.

Aroma: heavy on sweet malts, berry like fruity accents.

Medium-full bodied. Clean malty front supported by healthy dose of green fresh hops. Fruity finish with late hop reappearance. Good hop, malt work .Gentle balancing. Soft texture and more fruit character than pils, hops less crisp.. There are beers with better malt work from Czech Rep yet its hard to find such balanced lager brewed in USA as Great Lakes Dortmunder.

12 oz bottle courtesy of crizay. Gold to orange-ish color with thin white head. The aroma is sweet citrus and a hint of pale Munich type malts. Flavor is sweet caramel mixed with citrus hops to create a candy orange-malty flavor. Leaves a pleasing taste behind that is slightly sweet citrus but not too sweet.

Bottled.  Ive had lots of this, just havent rated it.  Poured clear, lighter orangey-golden with a respectable cap of white head.  Nose was of sweet caramel and nutty sweetness with a pinch of lemon zest and a bit of honey.  Flavor had a bready pils malt backing with fresh caramel and herbal/lemony zest to it... flowed so well!  Smooth on the palate with mild bitterness in just the right places... well-crafted beer!
Bottle courtesy of rockinout.  Pours gold with a white head.  Smells of nuts, hay.  Tastes of lemons, slight bitterness, pilsner malt.  Finish is light and refreshing the way a good dort should be.
Dark yellow color with a small head. Aroma of greain, wheat, and honey. Tastes very similar with some honey and very slight orange.
Brownish amber color. Smooth, medium body. Lighter in hops than I like, but probably true to style. A quality brew!

12oz bottle acquired in trade with OhioDad (thanks!). Poured a medium orange color with a smaller sized head. Aromas of grain, light honey and citrus. Tastes of grain, some honey sweetness, citrus, and a little bready.

Consumed from the bottle. Born-on date is 7/8/06. Decent malty and grainy aroma. Smells a lot like a richer Grain Belt Premium, in my opinion. Flavor is similar to the nose; rich tasting and hearty for a lager. Basically, when a non-beer drinker thinks of the taste of beer, they think of this beer. The beer left a scratchy unpleasantness in the back of my throat and the flavor grew very sharp as the beer warmed. This one is best enjoyed ice cold, I would think. Its a well-crafted lager to be sure, but I cant be non-biased in my review since I do not generally like grainy lagers. This was the worst beer Ive tried by Great Lakes, which is a compliment to the brewery. This beer isnt awful by any means, and more than drinkable for anyone who doesnt like the "dark" or "strong" beers.

UPDATED: DEC 18, 2006 Bottle, pours golden with a bit of amber, foam appears and runs away, aromas of malt, sweet malt and bread, flavors of malt, sweet malt, little bitterness from the hops, tasty, creamy and smooth, very good.
11/18/06: Bottle.Golden orange body with a thin ring of carbonation.  Bread-like nose.  Nicely balanced.  Clean and refreshing.  An excellent brew to wrap up the OSU-M game.  GO BUCKS!!!

12 ounce bottle from GrbDg.  Pours crystal clear amber with just a bit of white head.  Stong noble hops aroma with a sturdy Vienna malt presents.  Really quite bitter, with a pleasant toasted sweetness up front.  Finish is dry and crisp.  I never thought Id want to live in Cleveland.

A good golden lager, I agree with larryg, it does seem very german.  Golden color as was expected, tastes like a very balanced blend of hops and malt.  A good beer, but Great Lakes has better offerings

really like this golden lager. seems very german, like the bitburger i had in munich a few years back.  great color and good foam. perfect balance of hops,malt & yeast. american beer at its finest. its not the best beer ive ever had but for its style its really good. went really well with the fish fry i had too.
Golden color, good-sized head.  Sweet flaver for a lager.  Also more body than most lagers.  Perfect lager for those who arent crazy about lagers!
Excellent beer. Pours a strong yellow orange with a nice lacing ring. Aroma is strong hops and fresh water. Flavor very refreshing, with a great balanced hop malt flavor.

(draft @ The Aspinwall Grille - Aspinwall, PA) Clear gold in color with a thick and lasting white head. Aroma is nice and bitter with some floral hops and a touch of cookie dough. Flavor is very bitter and crisp at the beginning with a smooth and hoppy middle and a dry and bitter floral hop finish. Finishes like a really nice pils.
Nice. Pleasant. Crisp. Very carbonated. Doughy for being relatively light, but has a complex almost browned pizza crust finish. Great.
UPDATED: JAN 3, 2007 i like this lager nice everything all around not to much to say about lagers. thin to medium white head nice balanced lager taste. great lakes puts out some nice beers.

UPDATED: NOV 5, 2006 Better than GL burning river.  However, not as smooth as I think a genuine lager should be.  Not too much carbonation. Has a lingering slightly bitter aftertaste and finish. I still am not sure why great lakes beers rate so high. Will not buy again.
user_location: Beaver Valley, Beaver County, Pennsylvania, USA

text: Bottle. Deep dark brown body with a medium film of bubbles. Nose-seltzer, weak iced coffee. Taste-light coriander, high CO2, iced coffee, the taste of a stale bar, pecan shell with astringency, soil. The usual brown ale flavors are here, but they are very sharp and well done. An excellent example of the brown ale style. Would be a good beer to have with food.
A great flagship beer.  An unusual style that has been perfected by Great Lakes.  I always enjoy having this beer around the house.  Not too malty, but still very good.
Bottle from The_Epeeist Nose of a little yeasty caramel and citrus; amber with a small beige head; flavor of spicy caramel and citrus malts with a small hop finish.
Poured a beautiful dark golden with lots of bubbles.  NIce head.  This is really an outstanding beer, one that I would definitely order in a bar or with a meal.  Not too heavy but very very nice

Initial taste is of a typically over dry lager.  But in all fairness to it, it is a helles... so, on second sip I noticed a world of difference.  Pale golden yellow with a nice bubbly head.  Light malts and a medium hop flavour.  This is a very decent brew.

Bottle.  Pours golden yellow.  Bright white bubbly head.  Slight hops aroma.  Flavor was rich hops and malt.  Light aftertaste of hops.  Nice full bodied lager. I wouldnt hesitate to drink this again.

Bottle: Pours golden in color with a small white head. Smells of fruit, some kind of berry. Taste was similar, maybe blackberry or raspberry in flavor, but certainly not like a lambic... Just a hint of fruit. Very good and enjoyable beer.
Bottle.  Strong honey malt aroma.  Orange yellow with small head.  Sharp hops flavor initially followed by a nice smooth sweet malt.  Moderate hops aftertaste.  A great beer.
Clear amber body with a thin white head. Sweet light floral hop aroma. Sweet fruity flavor with some light citrus and grassy hops.

Golden body with a thin white head.  Aroma of orange, hops and some light spice.  Very nice body, smooth grapefruit from the hops.  Some very light malts with a light fruit profile.  Smooth ending, very enjoyable.

Draft, at the brewpub.  Poured a ice copper amber with a thick off-white head.  A touch of hops in the aroma with a mild malt body.  The hops are evident in the flavor up front but are quicky balanced by a mildly sweet malt body and a subtle bitter finish.  Crisp, and smooth this is a good beer!

Pours a golden color with thick head and fades quickly.  Nice lacing in the glass.  Smell is very sweet malt, some grassiness, not much else.  Taste is much the same and it doesnt do much right.   There is not a lot going on and it makes for a boring beer.
Had on draft in Maumee, OH was not what I would put on recommended list. Watery, to sweet, bitter after tast. Very little malt flavor for this style of beer. nothing special here.
This was good. Had this on tap in Clevelend. Lightly hopped. Little sweet like a sugar cookie. Pretty smooth going down.

Bottle, Ive been waiting forever to try this. Pours a perfect clear golden with a thick, billowy white head. Grassy noble hop nose with fresh grains. The flavor is well-balanced, understated and totally delicious. Has notes of freshly-cracked pale grains, multiple layers of light caramel, hay, grass, lemon, light bread and a very clean yeast. I would kill to have a freshly-baked pretzel with this. Pleasantly sweet with the perfect amount of balancing hops. Medium bodied with a very smooth texture and lively to moderate carbonation. Lacing hangs on the glass like clouds, great head retention. A total brewing masterpiece.

light gold color with a fragile malty aroma hiding some grassy german noble hops.  the aroma is exactly as i imagine beer smells like - as vague as that is, its more reactionary than analytical.  in your mind, picture a beer and smell it.  thats what this smells like: grains, hops, and yeast.  the flavor feels a bit underhopped (or just under-attenuated) and although thats the intent, its a little more syrupy than it ought to feel.  soft finish that should leave a more lasting impression.  i feel like this beer robbed me after its aroma.

Thanks to iowaherkeye. Clear golden, fairly large head, average lacing. Aroma is lotsa bready malts with a hint of grassy hops. Hints of fruit, toast, and caramel. Good mouthfeel, light sweetness. Probably the best Ive had for the style. Excellent for what it is.

Bottle: Clear gold with a white fizzy head.  Malty aromas of barley and corn.  The taste is better than the aroma - pretty mellow and fairly sweet.  Very easy to drink and could be refreshing on a hot day.  Thanks BuckeyeBoy for bringing this back from Ohio!
12 OZ BOTTLE Pours out a nice orange gold, topped with a very light off white head. a little grass and hop. good over all.

(bottle from kevin or kramer)body was a golden (surprise) color witha nice white head.aroma mixed up hay,hops,and some caramel malts.flavor was a nice blend of apple juice,grassy hops,and juicy fruit gum.pretty tasty stuff i must say.

via trade with OhioDad - Pours a clear orangish-golden color with a faint head.  Light carbonation.  Has a strong grassy, earthy hop aroma.  Has a light grainy malt flavor with a tad bit of residual sweetness.  Light to medium body.  Good beer.  Thanks Scott.

UPDATED: JUN 20, 2010 Pours a clear amber with a small, beige head. The aroma is biscuit, bread dough, light toffee and lots of grassy herbal hops. The flavor is bready, herbal, slightly grassy, touch of lemon, nice and dry with a light bitterness and a touch of dusty yeast. Medium body, soft carbonation. Beautiful beer, one of my all time favorites.

bottle - Pours golden with a moderate head.  The aroma is mild and has a little hops in it.  The is lightly malty with a good, moderately strong hops presence.  The finish is crisp and smooth with a touch of lingering hops.  It goes down easy, but is flavorful and not too thin.  Great Lakes has made a very good session brew.

As the description says, this is a sorta middle of the road, as far as hop to malt balance goes, lager.  Its quite well made, being crisp and clean without being boring, but it doesnt knock my socks off for a lager, but thats probably more just my taste (Prima Pils tends to impress me as a lager, but thats just my taste).  If youre looking for a nice bottom fermented beer, and this is around, consider yourself lucky!.

Thank to OhioDad for this one.  Crystal clear, pale amber/gold with a creamy white head.  Very appealing appearance.  Nose of noble hops, light crackery malts, some minerally character as well.  Very light and crisp body, light earthiness and a crisp minerally flavour.  Noble hop flavour and a great moderately bitter finish.  As it warms, the malts come out more showing a toasty sweetness but its still very well balanced.  Too bad this is my only bottle.

Thanks to Secret Santa for this one.  Pours hazy golden coppery (more on the gold side) with 1-finger clingy, off-white head.  Aroma of bready malts, citrus, hops, some spicy hints, and even a little orange marmalade on toast.  The flavor is bold, fairly dense and complex on the palate.  It is initialy bready malty, with a solid citrus presence and finishing hops.  Smooth and crisp, with more spiciness as it warms, and a steady bready malt, citrus, and hop component throughout.  Very good.  One of the bolder and denser, if not the boldest and densest, Helles Ive yet quaffed.

This is my favorite Great Lakes beer, outside of the Blackout Stout of course. The beer is easy to drink, and unassuming. The pour is a golden yellow color with a white head. There is plenty of carbonation in this one to be sure. The aroma is a letdown--just nothing there really. The taste is very simple and balanced. A nice mix of hops and malt. The finish is clean, which is nice considering that most G.L. beers seem to finish with a bitter taste. A very solid beer."
Bottle. Pours clear orange gold with white head. Aroma is malt and caramel.Flavor is malty-fruity.
An extremely smooth brew. Gold pour with hints of light brown sugar. A lasting hoppy finish but not dry. Goes refreshingly well with shrimp, burgers, or chicken.

Bottle (12oz).  Pours a bright clear copper-tinted gold with a large fluffy-rocky beige head.  Clean aroma of sweet malt, grain, dry floral hops and hints of fruit and yeast.  Taste - oh man thats nice - nutty sweet malt, fresh cereal grain, light herbal/floral hops, delicate tasting with a sweet chewy finish.  Soft, chewy, fairly full-bodied mouthfeel, extremely tasty - I can see why this is rated so well, I could drink a six-pack of these pretty much any time, not too sweet, just great taste and a true palate-pleaser.
This is a lager that has great balance. Personally i would like it top be a little hoppier, but for a lager it finsihes clean if not crisp.  Well assembled and very drinkable.

Im fairly new to Great Lakes but they are batting 1000 right now in my book.  A very nice lager - wished I had another.  From the bottle.  Moderate, white head.  Light carbonation.  Very clear, amber-orange color.  Fruity / floral aroma - not acidic citrusy - sweet fruity.  Light to medium body.  Flavor was much more balanced than a typical lager - sweet, calm.  Very easy to drink.  Finishes just a tad bitter - in a good way.  Great beer - definate rebuy.
This was the first dortmunder Ive had, but I like it so far. Easy drinking, balanced malt and hops. Tilted to the malt side perhaps. Its good stuff.

12 oz bottle.  Clear copper-yellow with a slowly dying puffy white head.  Faint wheat, citrus, grass and oats.  A crisp and mellow lager with some sweet lemon and sticky resin.  Medium light; dry finish with some chalk.

This is still one of my favorite beers from the Great Lakes brewery. A great lager with just enough hops to give it a great finish. I allways make sure to throw back a few when Im able to get it on draft.

UPDATED: JAN 14, 2007 draft at the brewery.  Aroma:  Heavy on the malt sweetness with an underlying aroma of noble German hops.  Appearance:  A deep golden color, with a tinge of red when viewed away from the light.  Moderate, creamy white head.  Flavor:  Taste is very subtle.  Malt flavor of bread with some sweetness poking through.  Just enough hop flavor and bitterness to blance the maltiness.  A well crafted flavor.  Palate:  Medium bodied with a somewhat creamy texture on the tongue.  Good carbonation, and a crisp finish.  Overall:  Ive had this beer dozens of times, and it still holds up.  A very well balanced beer that is highly drinkable.
An easy to drink have anytime beer. Pours with a dark honey golden color with a nice size off-white head. The entire aroma of the beer was too sweet for my liking and left a sharp hop taste.

Thanks to doulos for this one. A very fine beer, indeed. Poured a deep golden color with a nice initial head and great lacing throughout the duration. The aroma was malty sweet (maybe some honey?) with a light maybe resinous hop presence. The flavor was similar, really good, well-balanced, and easy to drink. The mouthfeel was a little thick for the color and my expectations, but in a good way. Very pleasing and far superior to the "helles" style beers Ive had, that it gets lumped with.
Poured to a reddish copper with thick white heasd and decent lacing. Aroma was hops, but I also detected honey and fruit..possibly cherry. A slightly fruity, spicy flavor, and a very good finish.

Aroma - good maltiness to the nose with a nice dark gold tone to the color.  Great malt/hops balance with a nice medium body and just a bit of bitter at the finish.  My 2nd favorite Great lakes beer right behind Glockenspiel Weizenbock.

Aroma: Moderate noble hops and some maltiness in the nosel.

Apperance: A deep gold color with a nice white head.  Very clear beer.

Flavor:  There is a nice balance between the hops and  the malt. With a lingering sweet finish.  

Palate: Medium malt body with a crisp finish and good carbonation.

Overall: Very nice beer with a strong foundation of spicy hops and good Pils malt.
Tangy, with hoppy aroma.  Medium gold, clingy thin head.  Lightly sweet, well-bittered, with west coast hops.  Crackery.  Finishes bitter and resurgent.  Like a golden APA.
On tap at brewery. Golden in color with a white head. Malt aroma. Great tasting beer with a little sweetness too it. Great balance between hops and malt.

Bottle.  Pours light copper with white head that last.  Brilliant clarity.  Aroma is dominated by malty sweetness, but noble hops are definitely there.  Malty sweetness upfront, but balances nicely with the hops.  Bitterness lingers into the finish.  Overall, this beer hits the style dead on.  Its a lighter beer style, but has enough going on in it to quench your thirst.  Very nice beer.

Good golden yellow color, small white head.  The aroma is decent, a nice mix of hops and malts.  The flavor is a good hop start, that ends with a clean malty finish, easy to drink.
pretty good.

12 oz bottle.  Dark golden yellow body with a small white head.  I thought the aroma as awful, reminded me of a frat basement on Sunday morning.  The flavor, however, wasnt bad at all.  A touch of hop bite, a touch of malty sweetness.  Nothing outstanding, but a drinkable beer.
Full bodied golden color.  German malty aroma. This beer is all about good balance.  Dry hay and a light carmal malt.  I enjoy my beer with more hops.  This one doesnt excite my tastes much.

Pours clear golden / amber with a white frothy head.  Aroma is crisp, yet creamy, lightly roasted malt. The mouthfeel is medium bodied with some richness and medium carbonation.  Starts with rich malts with a small amount of caramel and a bit of spiciness.  The spice picks up as it goes along and merges with the dry hoppiness of the finish.  The malt becomes a dry caramel as it goes along.  A nice beer.
(Bottle)  Pours a clear copper body with a spare white head.  Aroma of caramel malt, apple, and toasted bread. Falvor of caramel malt.

Gorgeous golden hue.  Medium thickness.  Nicely carbonated.  This is what I imagine a good midwest brew to be.  Full flavored with just a touch of bitterness and aftertaste.  This is a really nice beer.
Pours out a dark yellow color with a nice little hop smell.  Taste is smooth, rich, and typical of the style.  Not bad at all, not something to cellar though.
On Tap: Typical for the style, well put together.  Had with a spicy steak sandwich and this was a good pairing.  A little hoppy, fuzzy mouthfeel.
a decent beer, once again its a typical midwest beer, nothing special setting this golden lager apart from anything else we have tried

Thanks to OhioDad for this brew. Fading thick white head, body is amber.  Gorgeous looking beer.  Aroma is honey, and citrus, with fresh malts.  Taste is very malty, with a floral sweetness to it.  Very refreshing.

Clear, bright golden amber w/ frothy white foam. Nice lace. Sweet, malty, lightly toasty biscuity aroma w/ notes of caramel & herbal complements. Rich, chewy feel. Flavour is moderately sweet w/ a crisp, bitter, mildly acidic finish. Notes of caramel & honey linger as well.

Aromas are like a sweet pilsner with white grape notes.  Color is a nice clear amber, and due to a mispour, I am looking at about a three inch head.  As the head dissipates, it is lacing pretty nicely.  Flavor is sweet and malty.  There is definitely a fruity note to this one, but it is a sweet white grape/honey/citrus.  Fairly light and not bad... but kind of blah.
user_location: The Wet Side of a Dry Town, Pennsylvania, USA

text: On tap at Smoking Lizard in Akron, OH.  This looks like decent lager.   A crystal clear goldish tan with a nice white head.  The aroma smelled like sour grapes, reminded me of a Bud light.  The flavor did too, nasty corn flavor with no hops anywhere.  I found this comparable to a BMC, I didnt even finish it.  I dont think it was dirty lines either, because my previous beer was great.  Aweful.

UPDATED: AUG 16, 2007 Rerate.  12oz, please enjoy by 10/24/07  clear yellow amber with a one finger white head.  Aroma of sugar cookies, sweet biscuits, and light piney and spicy hops.  Flavor is much the same with the hops doing a great job of keeping this from becoming very sweet, though if I were to describe this Id say it was sweet.  Bitterness peaks around a 3 or 4--closer to a 3.  Light to medium body with moderate carbonation.  



Old rating follows.  12oz. bottle, enjoy by May 31/06.  Aroma of hay, citrus hops with a biscuity background.  Pours a clear dark gold with a moderate white head.  Flavor of floral hops and biscuity malts.  Sweet finish.  Pretty good--the best lager Ive had in recent memory.  8-4-8-3-14--3.7
user_location: Ocean Beach, San Diego, California, USA
