text: Golden with a full white head.  Fruity and hoppy with a it of citrus.  Heavy and malty with a lingering sweetness.  Just a bit too heavy for me.
user_location: Peoples Republic of Athens, Ohio, USA

text: Pours amber with a large white head. Subtle aroma of sweet malt and honey-like German hops. This one is advertised as a happy median between a German Pilsener and a Munich or Vienna Lager, and it certainly is. Not as thick and sweet as a Vienna and without the hoppy bite of a Pilsener. There are hops, though, and they come across as pleasantly subtle, their earthy spices blending very well with the bready and slightly caramel-ish malt. One of the most flavorful Lagers Ive come across, and incredibly drinkable to boot.

(Bottle (best by 4/3/06) via trade with <A HREF=http://www.ratebeer.com/ViewUser.asp?UserID=2 target=blank>OhioDad, thanks Scott!) Drank from my new Ayinger willibecher! Pours a light golden amber. Foamy off-white head. Sloppy lacing. Smells pretty doughy, then as head recedes I pick up Belgian yeast-like aroma, maybe a little skunkiness too. Mouthfeel pretty light and clean, some prickliness. Tastes fairly bitter up front, then light maltiness. Also tasting the Belgian yeast I was getting in nose - surprising. A little tangy, citrusy. This is real refreshing and tasty but not as malty as I would have expected.
Clear gold. Frothy, off white head. Nose is perfume, fruit, and malt. Flavor is the same with a bit of piney hops in the finish. Light body, easy drinking. Crisp, refreshing lager.

"Poured a darker golden color with a good head great lacing. Aroma was malty and some hops it in there as well. Flavor was of sweet malts some hops which balanced very well. Good beer could drink this more often if it was around"

this was a dissapointment, and it is astonishing that it would have a 3.6 overall.....anyways, pours clear golden with no head....aroma is indistinct (i guess somewhat malty?...maybe a pinch of hops as well)...flavor was a bit better, but not much; slightly macro-ish in nature, but has a cleaner and much stronger flavor (somewhat grainy...slighty bitter)....good palate however
Pours with a golden color and a medium sized white head.  The aroma was enough to make me try it right away.  Dry, very little bitterness and very smooth.

(12.29.05) On tap at Firkins, Libertyville, IL. Clear golden amber hued having a large white head with good lacing. Sweet malt aroma. Medium bodied that starts with light malt sweetness and honey flavors. Finishes with pleasant light malt aftertaste.  No discernable bitterness. A very good malty session beer.
Wow!  When I saw the word lager, I gotta admit my expectations were low -- this one surprised.  it had a nice full body, great style, really a well done beer.  I like it!

Pours golden with a nice white creamy head. Mild aroma of floral hops, esters, and malt. Flavor is nice, but not overpowering.  Dry, slighlty bitter finish. A very refreshing brew. I could drink a lot of these in the summer.
This beers offers a sour mash aroma.  It is Venetian gold in color with only a minute smidgen of a head.  It offers a dry bitter lingers badly on the palate.

Bottle thanks to Styles: Pours to a clear bright golden yellow with a small, yet thick, creamy white head.  Aroma is very fragrent, showing notes of spicy hops, grassy, floral hops, lightly bready malt, sweat, clean light fruit notes.  Taste has a punch of spicy/floral/grassy hops, but theyre much more flavorful than bitter.  Theres also notes of pilsner-like malt, light bready dough, and a light fruity yeast.  Medium-lively carbonation, light bodied without ever getting watery, both the carbonation and spicy hops play with the palate throughout.  Finishes with a crisp bitter floral hops.  This has just a fantastic aroma compared to so many others that just have boring, muted aromas.  Masterful brewing here, blending just the right ingredients to produce a top-notch beer that is a real treat.

Average lager appearance.  Head is nicely creamy.  Pretty aromatic, with a little hops and spiceness in aroma.  Maybe also flowery.  My first taste I detected a lot of dryness and a surprisingly thicker than expected palate.  I was appreciative of both aspects however.  The other beers of this style Ive tried had no where near this ones character.
Pretty enjoyable beer. Fresh smooth graininess. Starts with what seems like alot of malts but the finish is dry bitter hops. Has a little bit of smokiness to it.  Somewhat thick on the palate.

Clear golden straw body with gentle carbonation and a clean, sudsy white head. Aroma of fragrant spicy hops and fresh nutty pils malt. Fresh grain flavor with nutty, buttery richness, mild fruitiness, and substantial spicy and woodsy hops. Nice balance of lightly sweet malt and hop bitterness. Residual sweetness offers some good texture. A very refreshing pale lager with enjoyable characteristics.

Mega-dry, bread like flavor with almost no finish. Aroma is pretty weak and slightly offensive... wasnt able to distinguish this much from a typical macro lager... stronger, more balanced, yes, but didnt offer any more alternative flavors.

Hoppy, malty, bready nose, amber, a finger of white foam head, fair carbonation, pretty lace. Flavour starts  malty,  hops follow, biscuity, crackers also. Well balanced, pleasant bitterness, even has the right mineral content. A very fine example!

Thank You joey_capps!

Initially there is a spicy hop aroma but that mellows and a light malt, cornish aroma is more noticeable.  Clear gold, sort of copper with a thin white head.  Flavorful, spicy hops, malty (corn), hard to explain as it isnt very complex, but is well balanced and enjoyable.  Watery texture, lighter body and a crisp finish

This looks nice, Orange and cloudy. Weirdly, this seems to have a little smokiness to it. It has the too dry finish and flaws that bring this style down in general, but you can easily see why it won awards. Pretty decent with some hidden hops showing themselves late.

A very nice German lager. the sweet malty body stands out the most. more hops start to sneek out after cooling down a bit. I had it with some leberwursts, not bad. but then again GLBC is pretty consistant with their offerings. prost!!

This has an interesting balance between being very bitter and very malty, but comes across as neither.  I really like this beer, but something about it would keep me from drinking it on a regular basis.

Amber almost gold-bronze. Foamy head and small lacing. Malty aroma, slightly sour. Doughy and wet with a mild hop bite. Bitter and nutty. Flavor contains more bitterness and some citrus. Caramel and roast malts that are earthy and sweet. Heavy in the mouth with a bitter tail.
UPDATED: NOV 27, 2005 Bottle.  Very nice, pleasent tasting beer.  Floral on the nose.  Some slight hoppiness tempering the malt.  Good session beer.  Thanks David.

Yellow/gold, with a white head. Aromas are malt, yeast, and a slight bit of grass. 
Flavors are malt, hops, grain , and a touch of flowers and fruit. Very nicely done, better than expected. If this were readily available in my area, it would make a great session beer. Thanks to OhioDad for this extra bottle.

Poured a clear golden color, with only a thin head and mild lacing.

Smell is mild floral hopsand malt. It also has what I can only describe as a grainy quality to it.

Taste is initially sweet malts, followed by that grain quality, finnishing with just a touch of hop bitterness. It has a medium bodied mouthfeel and goes down pretty good.

Im not a big lager fan, but this beer was better than I was expecting. Im glad I picked up a 6er of this while I was in Ohio.
user_location: Where the hell am I?, Nebraska, USA

text: dark yellow pour that verges on brown  with some orange when held to the light. a nice white head sits atop this. grassy cotton and sugar nose. nice flavor that is sweet like a caramel square and biscuits. light hop level on the back side. great balance.  lingering honey flavor keeps me coming back for more.

Bottle: Poured a clear light copper color beer with a nice clean white bubbly head with pretty good retention. Aroma of floral malt and subtle hops. Taste is very refreshing with a good malt presence, a full body (for the style) and medium bitterness at the end. Very good for the style.

This is a really interesting beer.  Apples, honey and cinammon in the nose.  Dark yellow color with minimal head.  Perfect malt and hop balanced palate, though delicate.  Light finish, almost no finish.  Thanks to Ron for trading this to me!

Bottle. Obtained in a trade with JCW. Pours a nice amber with a small white head. Aroma is semi-sweet with lots of grains, light citrus, mild hops, malts, and light cereal notes. Taste is laden with cereal and grains, light citrus (some lemony notes), light grassy notes and mild hops. Body is light-medium with some moderate carbonation feel. Light bitterness in this. Finishes with a larger bitterness, more lemon zest, light maltiness and more grains. At one point I thought I tasted Total cereal. Good but not as great as I had been hoping.
UPDATED: SEP 16, 2006 Biscuity aroma and the flavor is very much the same. Average hops and surprisingly good malts.

Draft and bottles (many). Clear golden color with a wel maintained head. Aroma of  grain with faint hop presence. Just the right mothfeel for the style, with a refreshing hop bitterness in the finish. Beautifully balanced.

I picked this up in Morgantown WV while visiting my daughter at WVU.  I live on a Great Lake (Ontario) how come they dont sell this in my town?  Straw color with a decent white head.  Aroma of hops and yeast.  Stong hops and yeast flavor.  Crisp
A very good beer.  Seems like something that would be more accessible by non-beer-geek hoi polloi.  Make your friends try it.

Pours a golden / amber with a thin white head. Aroma is a little mild with scents of yeast and hops. The flavor is very well balanced with a crisp finish ( quite refreshing ). The taste is malt, hops, honey, and yeast.

Poured straw colored with a nice white head that stuck around. Sweet odor of yeast rolls. Flavor was light and pleasant with flavor of unbuttered popcorn and malt. Well balanced and perfect for a hot day.

Thanks to Ohio Dad for this one!!

Typical fine product from Great Lakes.  I always say this should be the transition beer for macro drinkers to try when contemplating moving to craft beers.  Floral hopping, lightly roasted malts, and a little corn sweetness.  Good.

Thanks to OhioDad for this beer.

Pours an effervescent golden with a creamy white head that dissipated almost completely.  Sweet corn aroma with a touch of grassiness.  Taste is light and slightly sweet corn with a nice grassy hop kick.  Dry corn dominates the finish.  Very drinkable and enjoyable lager.

Pours transparent reddish amber with a large white head that fades to a thin layer. Aroma is of slightly grassy slightly spicy hops and a firm but clean maltiness. Flavor is of full but clean light maltiness and some grassy somewhat spicey hops. Hoppiness grows in the finish. Medium body and smooth palate. One of the most drinkable beers I have ever had. Great balance.

My least favorite in the Great Lakes Brewing Company sampler pack, but a formidable selection nonetheless.  It is a great beer, the best of this varietal yet (for me).  HOppy, malty, has a little bit of everything.  A very higly reccommended beer.

UPDATED: SEP 22, 2007 Grainy and hay-like aroma. Pale gold with a fluffy white head. mmmm smooth and wet with a an almost banana sweetness. Has a tone down malt base with a an ever so fleeting hint of hop in the finish. This is really extremely well done. Probably very underrated at 89, but then its a light style. Really a fantastic beer. Geeks often talk about macro replacements, but if this was the dominant light lager the beer world would be in a very zen like state of transcendence. A very nicely done beer that makes me wonder why I didnt like the porter (my favorite style) from Great Lakes nearly as much.

UPDATED: FEB 20, 2006 This is a very good beer.  It has a very nice color.  And pours with a nice head.  It goes down very smooth, with a light body, and a good bitter aftertaste.  The flavor is full of hops, and malt, with a hint of sweetness.  This is the most popular of the Great Lakes beers which are brewed year round.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2010 Sometimes you forget just how nice a style can be when you havent had a good example in a while.  I havent had this beer in a long, long time, but it is a great dort.  Thanks Secret Santa!  Medium gold, good head.  Aroma was of gentle malt and hay, faintly floral.  Great balance of these elements in the mouth as well.  Amazing finish, as everything just comes together and lingers in perfect harmony.  Hints of medicinal herbs as well.  Nice, nice stuff.  Rerate from draft at the Cleveland Airport location.  Notes and scores remained the same, a really nice beer.

My absolute favorite lager, hands down. Also my first choice (lately) of session or default beer. Exceptionally well-balanced, great moderate hoppiness and light body. Huge flavor considering what it is. Exceptionally drinkable.

Poured orange-amber, short creamy white head, short-lived, moderate lacing.  Aroma was pleasant, with fruity notes, yeast and hops.  Tasre was surprisingly bitter for a lager, but with a chewy malt background.  The herbal taste of hops stood out, though, with malt sweetness, earth, other herbs and spice in the background.  Nice mouthfeel, slightly fizzy.  Well balanced and full-flavored lager.

Draft, at GLBC. How did I miss trying this until now? Good pils color and a nice German hops smell. Thin head. A striking pale malt taste  yes, a pale-type lager with taste  with that slight note of hardened water. Nicely done.

UPDATED: OCT 31, 2007 Bottel for this review, but have had draft-brewery also. Pours clear with a decent sized white head. If you like balanced brews this one is for you.  When fresh, this is the king of American craft brewed lagers. Perfect on a hot summer day!

Gold.  Delicate, perfumey, herbaceous nose wth a light, clean, honey grain smell.  Large body and fairly flavorful, quite complex for this style, which I am not very familiar with.  Really toasty and rich, grassy and earthy with well developed malt flavors.

UPDATED: NOV 23, 2015 Bottle (BB Jan 09, 2016). Head is initially small, frothy, off-white, mostly lasting. Body is dark yellow. Aroma is moderately hoppy (toasted bread, grain, cereal), lightly to moderately hoppy (flowers, herbs). Flavor is moderately sweet, lightly acidic, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly acidic, moderately bitter, faintly husky. Medium body, watery/velvety texture, lively carbonation. A touch rough/raw in the malt department, but otherwise fairly decent.
Rich grassy hop aroma. Thin head, murky orange. Light bodied, sweet with grassy bittering hops. Slight earthiness.

Pour is a bright gold with a white head.  Aroma is malty with a touch of hops.  Flavor is crisp and dry.  Malts used in this one carry the beer.  If you in the mood for a malty lager then this is for you.

Poured an orange/gold. Decent, soapy head that dispersed within a few minutes. Nice lacing. Slight aroma is balanced with muted hops and malt. Flavor consists of bittering hops and some malt as well. Nice dry finish. Carbonation give it a good mouthfeel and adds some body. Overall, this is a nice lager with some hops flavor. I recommend this beer.
A golden color and light aroma.  Nicely bittered with a sweet/dry finish.  A nice clean crisp taste to the beer.

Light, shiny gold/amber color, thin creamy/soapy white head. Aroma has a wet, day old cut grass thing, along with a dry white-wine malt sense to it. Nice and pleasant sweet taste, with a papery note to it. Nice and crisp and very enjoyable overall, but maybe the sweetness will get annoying.
This is a great beer with a fantastic finish.  Works well with lots of different food, or by itself.

UPDATED: JUN 22, 2007 Pours golden with a fully receding white head.  Aroma is metallic lager yeast, herbal Hallertau, and a bit of sour corn mash.  Taste is bready, grainy, a bit metallic, with bitter grassy hops.  Mouthfeel is medium bodied with spritzy carbonation.  Great Lakes, please, please, stop the filtering and pasteurization, Dortmunder Gold would be stellar if youd just quit the nonsense. Beer should last longer than 3 months.
Golden pale lager color with no head. Aroma has some strange citrus character, but not hops. Flavor very clean and crisp with only a little citrus kick. One good thing is I knocked out another style.

On tap at the brewery.  Clear gold in color with a thin creamy white head.  Aroma is lemon butter on crescent rolls, along with some honey and lime juice.  Sweet and crisp; this aint no light beer.  Crisp and freshly baked biscuits.  Malt sweetening with a slight pils twang.  A little waxy on the palate, and a good summer quaff.

Light aromatic hops, crisp and a bit fruity. Mild grapefruit and citrus oil with touch of pine. Bright golden amber clear with foamy smooth white lacing head. Medium body, bit creamy, with medium carbonation. Starts crisp and hoppy, nice malty sweetness to blend out any astringent bitterness. Fruity and light on hops, nice acidity. Finish is clean and just a bit sweet. Light bitter after. A really nice lager, refreshing and clean.

Orange color, bright gold, puffy white head, nice lacing. Nose of biscuity malts & grassy hops. The flavor has a medium body & a strong bitterness supporting it. Finishes crispy & balanced. Traditional Dort. Nice.

Sampled last night.  I thought this was kind of a plain beer.  Reminded me too much of a Pilsner.  Aroma was malty and had some grainyness to it.  Flavor was a lot of grainy tasting malts and grassy hops.

Pours a clear golden amber color. Small white head, nice lacing around the glass. Aroma is malty, not sweet, but well balanced. Flavor has lots of caramel, candy sweetness to it. Also a grassy hop kick.

UPDATED: FEB 6, 2006 Im rerating this one because its a lot better than the first time.  The aroma is malty and grassy.  The flavor is full of malt and medium bodied.  A nice rounded taste typical of a good lager.  Taste is consistent from mouth to aftertaste.

"...enjoy by JUN 21/05"
Golden bodied (bordering on amber) with a creamy head that became a film in no time. Like a genie, its effervescence happily stated that it was glad to be back out of that bottle. Some buttered-popcorn, diacetylic aromas with grassy and herbal hops. Malts apparent in taste, after a mildly bitter start. More full-bodied than I expected. Id say Great Lakes acheived exactly what they pursued, congratulations!
<font size=-4><a href=http://www.ratebeer.com/Places/ShowPlace.asp? Liquors, Oak Forest, IL<font size=-1>

UPDATED: SEP 18, 2010 Bottle:  The aroma is bready with some light notes of caramel, honey, apple, and faint citrus.  It pours a transparent golden-amber with a large off-white head with very good retention.  The flavor starts lightly sweet with honey, caramel, and a hint of apple.  The finish has some light citrus notes, spice, and the faintest touch of grass.  Light-medium bodied with mild carbonation and a slight stickiness to it.  My review is pretty simple and really cant do the beer justice, but this is pretty much a perfect session beer.

MMMMMMM....great lawnmower brew and even past its prime it was crisp and refreshing with nice noble hop aroma and the buttery soft flavor of really good lagers.  Glad I picked this sixer up for only 4.99.  Nice.

UPDATED: MAY 14, 2005 Gold color on the pour but transparent.  Head settles quickly from an inch to an 8th.     Aroma is pretty caramelly and a little yeast.  A little dry hopped for good effect.  This is a very nice brew and the best that Ive had in this style!  Good malt flavor and a fantastic finish!

Tasted on 4/23/05. 12oz bottle, bb  02/04. (no wonder it was only $1!) Gold color with an off white head. Caramelly, malty, and hops arooma. NIcely balanced beer with caramelly malt flavor -> perfumy hops and a slight bitterness. Nice full body.

12 fl. oz brown bottle. Golden colour, with slight haze. Very tight, small white head. Nice malt aroma, slightly bready. Medium bodied with balanced clean malts, good hop notes providing mild bitterness and lingering in aftertaste.
Another perfect Great Lakes beer, I really enjoy this brewing company, the Dortmunder was smooth ad had a great aroma

pours a slightly orangish tinted gold.  my first dortmunder, this is quite interesting.  good body, smooth, you the malt profile and subtle hoppy finish make this an easy drinking lager that actually tastes good!

UPDATED: MAY 30, 2007 Very meaty malt smell, disappearing head, deep gold color. Faint noble hop aroma. Taste is very interesting. Nice mouthfeel with plenty of body to go along with a bit of fizz. Taste is full of flavor, if only a macro could put this kind of flavor in their lagers. Fruity flavors with floral hop notes coming through. A very nice beer that may become one of my standbys for the coming summer months.

A much nicer lager than I usually prefer - perhaps I need to know more about this Helles style. Nice gold colour with a creamy head. Slightly sweet malt aromas with a good hop balance. Medium mouthfeel of mostly fairly crisp malt but with touches of light hops too.
My first Dortmunder:  Lemony hops are inviting in the aroma.  Theres a real dryness all the way throughout the beer.  Leaves you wanting more.  Good stuff.
For about 1/2 this golden beer, I thought this was a top notch beer,  but after,  I had trouble finishing it.  Perhaps I am just a whimp

bottle.  Deep golden color with moderate head.  after trying other micro beers, this beer seems to have a mass-prod taste to it. taste doesnt jump out, safe beer for lawnmower drinkers to try.  I live in cleveland so its avail, but unless left at my house, i aint buyin it.

This beer has a nice cake aroma and flavor to it.  Syrupy malts would like a stronger hops presence but I understand that not really the style.  A fine offering from a brewery that never lets you down.
Perfect golden pour with a rapidly dimenishing off white head.  Very smooth going down with a nice amount of hops in the finish.

UPDATED: SEP 4, 2005 Deep golden in color with a two-fingered, sustained head, this has a sweet, doughy aroma with a touch of caramel.  Its got a good balance between hops and sweet malt in the taste and a crisp, snappy hop finish.  Another good brew from Great Lakes.<font size=-4><a href=http://www.shopcpn.com/webpage/display.cfm?ID Liquors/Armanetti Beveragemart, Chicago, IL<font size=-1>
This a extreamly engaging brew and my close proximety to cleveland guarentees fresh beer. The beer is think and heavy with good and has a very distinct dortmunder taste.
This is a fantastic beer, best on tap. Served commonly around Cleveland, its one that I enjoy often. This and the Christmas Ale are my two favorite Great Lakes brews. Highly recommended.

UPDATED: MAY 29, 2006 (draft, 5/27/06) Clear apple juice body topped by a white head.  Aroma is medium sweet, peach.  Taste is medium sweet, peach, some earthy, light spice.  Light-medium body, light stickiness.  (6/3/8/4/15)

(12oz bottle, 1/24/05) Clear amber body with white head.  Aroma is moderately sweet, bread, caramel, apple.  Taste is moderately sweet, bread, some apple, light bitterness (grassy/earthy).  Light-medium body, some crispness.  I was not sure how to rate this -- it seems to have all the characteristics of a very good brew, but for some reason it did not much appeal to me. (6/3/6/3/12)

UPDATED: NOV 30, 2007 Aroma distinctive, somewhat alcoholic.  Taste, kind of interesting.  Not bad at all, and Id take it over most American micros.  However, its not anywhere near close to the quality of the other beers that Great Lakes can produce.  If youre going to shell out enough money to buy their beers (which are pricey), you might as well get your moneys worth and buy something truly outstanding like the Burning River, Edmund Fitzgerald, or if you want a softer beer, the Locktender Lager or Conways Irish Ale.  Another thing thats a little strange about this brew...this is my opinion, but I swear it tastes exactly the same whether its on tap or in a bottle.

Rich golden almost amber color with a moderate head and a lacing that left rings. Fresh yeasty spicy aroma with a citrus touch. Medium bodied and it seemed well hopped for the style with a bready almost toasty malt flavor and oh so drinkable. Finished smooth and lightly bittersweet with a hint of clove,  just amazing stuff.
UPDATED: AUG 2, 2007 Golden pour with white head. Very different beer, spicy with a very subtle hop and malt presence. Slight swet malts and noble hops are what this beer is.

Bottle:  Clear golden w/ a lasting white head.  Grainy toasty malt w/ a floral hopa and moderate diacetyl aromas.  Flavor is well balanced, Lightly herbal hoppy and grainy malt.  Light diacetyl in the mouth.  Pretty clean otherwise. Well balanced throughout, finish is on the semi dry side and has a clean aftertaste that is lightly herbal hop.  Lighter bodied, smooth, creamy m/f, medium carbonation.  Overall not a bad beer, but I wish theyd go back to letting it sit on the yeast a little longer and stop trying to turn it out so quickly.  This beer was fantastic 10 years ago, but now its usually loaded w/ diacetyl, especially on tap.

A very nice Helles. My measuring stick has always been Christian Moerlein and this fellow Ohio lager is very similar. The head was larger than I expected and the aroma was slight and citrusy. The flavor was evenly distributed between malt and hops and was very drinkable. Not too sweet, not too bitter. I like it.

Great lakes is great.  I like all of their beer to one degree or another but this is one brew that everyone nation wide should replace for their generic lite lager.  The aroma is nice and not over powering with hints of malt and grass.  Good golden color with lite orange running thru it.  Very well balanced between malt and hops, Im not sure I can descibe it better than the commercial description.  I do want to note that compared to other more complex beers, this does not "wow" me, but Im not sure thats what this beer is trying to be.  I thnk Ive rated it fairly overall (i.e., with the same standards that Ive rated other beers).  However, for good tasting easy drinking, Im not sure Ive had better!  Its a solid beer for easy/everyday drinking.  Come on...Give it a try...what are you waiting for...
Light gold reddish color,clean satisfying malt hop blend aroma, dry lemony taste with a slight hop finish. A nice enough lager but the style really doesnt lend itself to much excitement.

very beautiful beer, nice dark golden color, with a white head.  nice lace left on the glass.  Didnt really pick up a strong aroma, but I detected both a hint of malt and hop in the aroma,  truely a delicious brew, nice malty sweetness that is well balanced but some hop bite,  only complaint I can make is that great lakes has the least creative bottle labels, but I do like the reading material on them
Maltiness, roasted maltiness, that I am eager to take down my throat.  Had this during a frantic bus ride into Cleveland from Wickliffe while campaigning in Ohio.
Sourish malty nose - buttery, noble hops.  Clean flavor is malty with a butted popcorn finish, a little lemon.  Nice finish with the butter.
Tried this because Im such a fan of many other GLB beers.  Average golden color didnt inspire me to want to really tear into this.  Not a bad beer, but Im just not a fan of this style.
Tried this at the Boneyard in Cleveland.  I had already tried the porter and a brown so this tasted a little light to me.  Still... a pretty clean and smooth lager. I enjoyed it.

Clear, peachy-golden-hued in appearance, very promising, with a solid heft of head above, soft and near-white in color.
Aroma, neutral, a bit grainy, right on for the average lager, airy and inoffensive. Nice enough.
Taste: smoooth, mild, big and malty, little hops on the palate, but everything slides very easily down. Grainy taste is easily met by light fruit, the body is medium, finish is long and lasting. Flavor sits forever in the mouth, thats is the biggest thing this brew has going for it. Its not one of those In-&-out-lagers, in the mouthfeel. big points for that, for the persistence, and the pleasure, and the all-out pleasant-ness going on here. If I were somewhere where this was the most intriquing selection, though Im no lager lover, its a beer I could happily sit with. Or stand, even. 
Actually, it tastes better the more you get into it...very nice. Yum, top notch lager!
I really enjoy this Dortmunder..I get it in bottles. Light,clean and crisp one of the better Dortmunders

Pint (or so), drunk as a lovely complement to Michael Stipe and Bruce Springsteen dueting on "Man on the Moon" at Clevelands Gund Arena, October 1.  Lovely malty/lemony aroma, juicy fresh well-balanced body, nice cutting but light bitterness throughout...I dont have a lot to say here really as I was paying attention to other things; but I really wish I could get something this good at all concerts and sporting events.

Nice golden/amber color,small white head that faded slowly and left a slight lace behind.Good light malty aroma with a slight hint of olive (Green) and maybe some hops and fruit as well.Nice fruity flavor some malt and a nice hop presence that doesnt get to out of hand but stays in the quite refreshing range.A very nice brew and im glad i have one more for later.Thanks go to Footbalm for sending me this brew and others from this brewery along with some great samples from his company.
Bottle.  Pours an amber to yellow color.  Whitish head, medium lived.  Aroma is a combination of malt and hop.  Mouthfeel is medium to light.  Taste is clean and crisp.  Pretty good beer overall.
Pours golden (obviously) with a small head and heavy carbonation. Taste is light, crisp, and malty. Low hops. Slight fruit aftertaste. A great summertime beer.

Bottle Pours a a slightly hazy light golden amber with a good foamy white head.  Aroma is a light fresh smelling grain, apple cider, and yeast with an easy hops trace.  Flavor is slightly sweet, bready and the slightly higer ABV is noticeable.  Feel is very light and crisp and the finish is quick, clean with just a hint of hops.  Very nice refreshing, light brew.

Light red with a great, huge, chunky, disappearing head.  Aroma a bit weak with light malts and a little citrus.  Flavor is lightly sweet, fruity malts, matched up with a solidly hoppy finish.  Feels both clean and silky, yet not sticky; nice.  Tasty.
sweet smell as it was poured, nice golden hue with a decent size head.  Just enough hops to keep the malt at bay.  Would recommend this beer to people
At a steak chain.  I was surprised at how much I enjoyed this beer.  Will order again and again.
First Dortmunder, I think.  I was surprised that I liked this golden beer.  Lots of malt, which Im not ordinarily a huge fan of.  I think Ill check out some more German styles after this one.

Clear deep golden in color with a decent white foamy head that leaves good lacing in my glass. Bready and flowery aromas, nice bready and grainy flavors, medium bodied, nice smooth mouthfeel, finishes clean and dry, very tasty and drinkable, this is an awesome brew.

UPDATED: OCT 19, 2015 By a long shot, the best Dortmunder Ive sampled.  Excellent color and head make this a very beautiful beer.  Nose is the weak point, but the flavor is also great.  A very clean, refreshing, and surprisingly good brew.

UPDATED: AUG 15, 2004 From a bottle - This poured a rapidly diminishing white gead of foam atop a rather dark amber body that smelled slightly of malt and grain. The taste, however, was truely upper-class, especially for a lager, and Irecommend this beer.

Its not that theres a bad aroma, there just isnt one at all, lots of sediment that you can even see through the bottle, it looks like sea monkeys bathing in gold, creamy mouthfeel, one of the better light beers Ive had recently.

UPDATED: JAN 29, 2005 Orange gold color. Medium white chunky head. Aroma is malty, fruity and sweet. A medium bodied helles. Malts are fruity and sweet. Hops are slightly spicy and a touch bitter. Hints of orange and honey. Nicely balanced. Light and refreshing, yet very flavorful. Nice beer. Mouthfeel is full and round. Finish is clean and smooth. Aftertaste is slightly sweet.

Clear golden color with a nice rocky white head. Light floral, fruity hop aroma. Slightly sweet malty flavor up front leads into delicous light crisp hop finish. A well crafted lager that was very enjoyable on this very hot afternoon.

(12-ounce bottle, obtained in trade, thanks Brian!) Holy shit! Someone pinch me! Finally an American brewed Dortmunder that actually tastes good! Nice, big, malty flavor, mildly sweet, with a complementing hops that is only mildly bitter yet still makes its presence known; Malty nose is nice, but the slightly sour aroma is a small minus; Fairly dry and medium bodied with a nice, full, coating palate that is soft and luxurious on the tongue; Deep golden color; Nice size to the off-white head, and retention is good, thanks in part to the generous supply of carbonation bubbles; Fair amount of patchy lacing, with one very large, unbroken section; Another quality brew from Great Lakes; Nice job, guys!
Orangy amber light arangy head. Light malty aroma. Sweet malty flavour. Light creamy palate. Slightly oily light dryness.  good hop aroma but more maltiness was coming through.
Not as strong as I was expecting. Slight citrus finish. Very smooth and drinkable.

UPDATED: AUG 20, 2004 Keith-Gorgeous golden color and a hops/malt aroma.  Not light or strong, this beer is unique to the nose, eyes, and mouth.  I could see drinking this in many situations. rating 3.2

Eric-pours light orange hue with nice white head-decent lacing from the start.  sweet, noble hop aroma-grassy and spicy with a touch of skunkness, but was not detracting.  flavors are spicy hops, slight malts and a firm hop bitterness on the finish.  good body and mouthfeal. the bottle said "best by 6/14/04 and it was still good!

Bottle pours golden, large frothy white head, fair carbonation, with sticky lacing. &nbsp Malts, grass, slight grain, and cheese on the nose. &nbsp Notes of malts, grass, and salt on the tongue. &nbsp Has a minor salty finish, slight sweet grass and malts, but a lingering light salty flavor. &nbsp Otherwise its fairly drinkable, but perhaps not my style. &nbsp Thanks goes out to TChrome for the trade!
Gold Coloring. Small Head.  Hops. Malt.  Not too bad...but pushin average for no distinctive taste.
Gold is a misnomer. This is a nice copper, not gold. Cloud-like head. Slight tingly hops in the aroma, and the hops back up the smooth malt in the flavor nicely. Tingles the tongue.
This is a good lager.  Nice head, golden color.  Aroma is a little malty and flavor has subtle citrus.  Definitely a beer to drink on a regular basis if you can get it.

Pours from the bottle with a medium, foamy, white head. The body is a slightly dark gold. The mouthfeel has more body than expected. Aroma is malts and green beans. The taste is green beans, grapefruit with a nice balance of the hops and malt. Lots of lacing. refreshing and good for the style.

pours a brilliant gold, with a white head that quickly turns to a long-lasting collar. flavor and aroma start nicely toasty and malty, but are eventually marred by emergence of butterscotch (diacetyl) notes as beer warms.

UPDATED: JUL 12, 2010 Gold with puffy head.  Nose is a bit lemony and sweet, slightly grainy, some excellent hops.  Flavor is light, somewhat grassy, bit of lemon.  Excellent hop bite at the end, very crisp, amazingly refreshing.  A glorious summer beer.

Bottle. Bright copper golden with small white head. Malty aroma, hints of honey, very light hops. Incredibly well balanced. Delicately malty, the finish is excellent. If I can get my hands on a fresher bottle Ill rerate this, otherwise this is a great beer.
Average flavored Dortmunder, light on hops and aroma.   Alcohol content was stonger than I expected.

Dark golden in color with a medium egg white head that is retained.  Aroma is fairly muted, but consists of light hops and light breadiness.  Flavor is also restained but exceeds the aroma.  Flavors of light hoppy bitterness, a little malt sweetness and a very dry finish.  Another good beer from Great Lakes.  I will enjoy this one during the Texas summer.

UPDATED: MAY 28, 2010 Original Rating, May 8, 2004:  Very golden color with little head.  Aroma is a little vacant... malt?  Taste is very well balanced between hops and malt.  Very clean.  Im a little torn because it is so balanced, but it also does not seem to have much to offer in the way of a flavor. 6/4/5/4/13  Re-rating, May 28, 2010:  Dark gold color with a quickly falling medium head.  Very faint aroma of grains.  Mostly a grainy flavor, with a bit of bitterness and astringency.  Fairly dry.  Hint of earthy hops.
A beautiful color. One of the best beers we have had that goes with almost any meal because of its overall balance. I have never had a bad beer from this legendary brewpub.
UPDATED: MAY 7, 2004 Uniquely bitter with a touch of sweetness at the end. Strong golden color. One of my favorite beers from the tap.
golden color with off white head a little bitterness with some sweetness liked this one
Moderate malty with a grain/hop tone. Clear medium amber color with large frizzy white head. Bitter flavor and finish that lasted a long time.
Golden color with a pretty rich white head.  Aromas of bready malts and a touch of hop zest.  Flavors of biscuity malts with a pretty hoppy finish.  A standby session brew.

UPDATED: AUG 9, 2004 Aroma of a combination of malts and hay.  A little hop bitterness with a full sweeter aftertaste.  Really a tough beer to describe.  Smooth yet strong, its flavor is very multidimensional. Very carbonated.

Smelled of honey and summer, but not strong.  Color was  dark gold, with a slight head.  Not sure what the flavor is, but it fits the well balanced between malt sweetness and hop bitterness description.  It is similar to the Pils but not as bitter or harsh.  It has a flavor that it tries for but what is it?  Palate was not too bad.  Overall, eh, probably a good Dortmunder, but not my style.  It does fit its description.
Poured a nice golden color with a good sized off white head.  Nice aroma of biscuity malts. Medium bodied with a nice biscuity malt taste, with just a touch of hop bitterness. A enjoyable brew.

Clear color of straw yellow gold, finger high head of beige foam that fizzes away fairly fast. A nice collar continues to hold its edge the whole glass down and the lacing stays close to the collar leaving minimal thin strings as it goes. Aroma is of fresh sweet bread dough, clean and pleasant, soft and well rounded, dryish with a bit of earthy factions of stone ground biscuit dough. Quite nice on the nose.
Ahhh... but the taste is where its really at, tasty biscuit malts, dry and clean, some whole grain and sesame notes, slightly bittered and buttery in the finish with touches of grassy spices. Very nice on the palate, very geniune, gentle, subtle, and another showmanship by Great Lakes of what it means to be well crafted. Feel is quite smooth with a solid medium, firmly built body, kinda fluffy, and an easy drinkablity, could choke down a few of these with ease. Seems sessionable enough, but being close to 6% may be much to ask from a whole sixer. But indeed that could be done without a blink of an eye. Yummy stuff!
Gold straw color. Light, but very pleasant aroma. Good body with nice clean bittereness and buttery finish. Just opening my eyes to the GABF "gold" behind the name. Well deserved I would say.

Somewhat neutral aroma.
Nice orange golden low head.
Compared to the average bavarian Helles available to me I found this one to be a bit too lightfooted - the solid malt footprint is simply not there. Maybe my sample was too small or I tasted beers in the wrong order, but this brew did not wow me...

The beer as it skedaddles from the bottle into my ever present empty glass a lustrous gold color with a purposeful in size bright white head with the texture frothy and the lace a fine film to cover the glass. Nose is quite earthy, reminiscent of fresh bread dough, sweet and fresh to the senses; the start is also sweet and nicely malted with the top moderate in its feel to the taste buds. Finish is orthodox in its acidity and the hops enduring in their spiciness, quite dry as the style dictates and a fine drinkable beer from this great Midwestern brewery.
gotta love the local stuff (I'm from Ohio) It has just enough bitterness to make you sit up and take notice, but not enough to turn me off. I can get  it almost anywhere in Ohio. I love it.

A nice gold colour. There is a slight sweetness, and also a flavor that reminds me of fresh bread.  But it's not heavy.  It goes down fairly easily.  This beer is available in most restaurants in the Cleveland area, and it goes extremely well with food.  There is a hop presence, but not too bitter.  I recommend this beer.
Lightly hazy gold with a tinge of amber.  Aroma lightly hoppy with herbs, grass, clean malt.  Perfectly balanced flavor, well made with clean malt and tingly hop flavors, and light finish.  Superb.

UPDATED: SEP 5, 2015 A nice smooth beer going down, and is probably the most popular from the Great Lakes Brewing Company. This beer goes down quick, which may or may not be a problem (depending on how drunk you want to get), and gets filling after a few. Its semi-sweet flavor isnt too sweet that youll tire of it... and its usually the first or second choice when I am in a bar.

Appearance is a shining clear yellow with a small white head that turns into a film and medium carbonation. Aroma is herbal, like I imagine is a typical Maine hay field by the end of the spring when it's still humid enough and not completely burnt by the summer sun. Restrained mild german hops in the aroma. Taste is all made of subtlety, never too sweet nor too bitter, perfect balance in that sense. I don't find much to be said really, excellent balance, medium body shows a perfect carbonation to my liking, quite creamy lager, pretty crisp dry herbal hops finish. Cheers Ciderguy!

UPDATED: APR 9, 2010 A honeyed narrator slowly shadowed by the oncoming spicy hops and biscuity malt chorus...A quiet caramel storyline comes and goes always accompanied by moderate hop melodies...The fresh cereal feel makes this a delightfully palpable lager...

Smells like hay, flowers, and week-old gym socks left to ripen.  Tastes much the same.  German noble hops figure prominently, but do not add much bitterness.  Basically, the malt profile does not impress, but a very passable beer.
(bottled).  Pale gold, brilliant clarity.  Soft, grainy nose with zippy continental hop aroma.  Medium-bodied, nice pale malt leadoff good bitterness to balance.  Clean finish.
Dark golden out of the bottle with a sweet malt nose and a nice white head.  Faint lemon citrus in the finish.  Nice hop bitterness and well balanced.  Very crisp, clean beer.
Clear orange.  Smells like a bail of hay, along with some honey and dark fruit.  Very crisp overall, with an oily finish.  Very tasty, full of tobacco, honey, hay and malts.
Not a huge lauger fan, but this one is not too bad.  Has a nice bitter taste to it, and no unrulely aftertaste.

Clear, deep golden lager with a large, off-white, creamy head.
Nice, malty nose and flavor with notes of butterscotch and caramel in each. Well-bittered and medium-bodied with a chewy mouthfeel and lively carbonation.
Smooth, clean finish. Not my thing, but very good for the style.
UPDATED: OCT 15, 2005 Light yellow colored, translucent, very little head.  Aroma is carmelish malt and hops may hallertau?.  Crisp flavor, moderately dry.  Dry finish.  Good Dortmunder
Nice golden color, with a light head. Kind of a bready flavor. Really hard to describe. Good though.

Looks like a lager, peach color. Nice white foam head. Smells floral, maybe a slight citrus smell. Definitely a little wheat. Not really that much flavor. A little musty perhaps. Very light flavor. A little tangy bitterness in the finish and that is it. Not the best Great Lakes has to offer but OK.

I got this in a 1/6 bbl from the brewery.  It has a beautiful golden color.  The smell is sweet like fruit, but also hoppy.  It has a very full taste for a lighter beer.  The malt and hops blend together very well.  This is a beer you can drink over and over.  Great Lakes is one of the best breweries around.

Bottle.  Pours dark golden color with a large white head leaving nice lacing.  Aroma is surprisingly ale-like, rich lightly roasted malts, spice  and floral hops.  Flavor also reminds me of a blonde ale, rich caramel malts and complex hop character.  Medium body with creamy carbonation.  One of my favorite lagers ever!
Copper colored with a small beige head. Malt aroma with a little hops. Malt and hop flavor. Bitter finish.

Dortmunder Gold is truly golden in color, such a deep gold that it must be seen to sppreciate the depth of color this beer displays. It has a great hop aroma which rivals a good bottle of Pilsner Urquell. The taste is very full and satisfying, with the clean lager finish. This beer will leave a lace that is extrordinary. Truly an exceptional beer.

UPDATED: JAN 25, 2005 2003 Bottle.
Pours a rich golden orange.  No sediment and very clear.  Aroma is sharp and spicy.  Good amount of white foamy head.
Begins very powerfully, with lots of strong, sharp yeast/hops flavor right away. However, there is an undercurrent of dry, flat grain taste that makes its way out shortly after the hops flavor has worn off.  The beer takes on too much a watery texture, especially as it warms.  I also found that the powerful up front taste gets very old after a few of these.  Not complex at all. Medium acidity.
Nice creamy Helles flavor, a step above their Locktender lager. More complex than most Dortmunders I've had. Refreshing and at least here in Cleveland always fresh.

Huge, frothy head, white as a sheet upon a golden straw body.  light, creamy palate and nose.  pale, creamy, sweet and smooth, then grainy and dry.  crisp.  a nicefruity, sweet finish.  mildly bitter and acidic.  very well balanced

Dayton, OH AleFest:The head was small sized, white and it quickly diiminished.The body was clear with carbonation observed.This beer's hue was yellow and the nose was lightly malty.The flavor was bitter from start to finish and it left a lingering aftertaste.The beer's mouthfeel was smooth, tingly and light-medium bodied.This beer's lacing was fair.

This brew poured a small head of finely sized mostly diminishing bubbles that left a good lacing and a transparent carbonated light golden orange colored body behind.  It had a mild malt aroma and offered up a smoth mouthfeel from start to finish.  Its flavor was mildly hopped.
straw yellow color with medium sized white head. Aroma is yeasty and dry. Flavor is yeasty, a very faint hint of hops, medium dry throughout. Nothing really special.
Big, brassy color! Just like the bottle says, this IS a very well-balanced, tasty, drinkable Lager. A little sticky on the hop finish, but very nice overall.
A nice lager.Yellow in color with small head. Aroma is very light with a bread malty smell.Taste is smooth and refreshing with a nice blend of hops and malt with a hint of fruit. Nice clean finish.
nice full body...with subtle but flavorful hop characteristics..giving off a nice spicy hop aroma..quite smooth and refreshing with hints of orange peel and mango
Had one really great glass & one ok glass.  Couldn't really complain with either, but the 2nd wasn't as good as the first.
An excellent lager. Good balance between the hops and malt. Strong dough/bread prescence in the flavor. Fairly big-bodied with a smooth and clean finish. Good stuff.

See through yellow gold, musty foot aroma that is somehow spicey as well.  Aroma reminds me of a beer garten on a cool, damp fall day. . . Good toasty bread flavour - fresh french crusty bread and sourdough.  The aroma wasn't that pleasant for me, but the flavour and clean finish makes up for it.

Golden with a off white thick and creamy head.  Deep malt aroma with a hint of dry floral/herbal hops. Thick and nearly chewy in feel. Lightly toasted bread sweetness in the front followed by a firm crisp hops bitterness. Smooth and satisfying.

Worthy of the gold medal, an excellent lager, give a couple bottles to friends. Picked this up while on business near Cleveland (didn't get a chance to visit brewery, maybe next time!). Nice golden color with small head. Aroma shouted german lager and the taste was clean with no bite. Works great with the spicy food I had for dinner that night. Very drinkable and highly recommended. Good dortmunder style beers are so hard to find in the USA.
UPDATED: JAN 28, 2004 This is one of the best beers I have had. Teriffic balance between hops and malt, great flavor, and decent aroma. I don't like many lagers, but this one is awesome.

The color is truly amazing, as close to being gold as any I've poured.  Short lived head with reasonable lace.  Hops are very present, but fade nicely in a good smooth aftertaste.  Touch of metallic to the aftertaste.  Smooth mouthfeel that makes me happy.

Golden colour with a very slight orange tint. Many small bubbles rising from the bottom, while a small white head sits atop. Smells of hops and malt and a semi-strong ale. A nice flavourful beer with definate hoppy inital taste with a very smooth aftertaste. A good all around beer, but not my favourite style.
This is a pretty decent ale for a local brewery.  I was quite pleased with it.

Draft at Great Lakes.  This Helles style beer was outstanding.  Amber color with nice head.  Rich malt flavor with a hint of sugar.  Excellent balance between the Malt and Hops.  Very smooth with a nice finish.

Dortmunder is in the top echelon of lagers.  Rich, golden pour with plenty of lacing.  The lager tastes like a liquid cookie, with bready, sugary malts and a slight acidic aftertaste, followed by hops bitterness.  Rich and luxurious, apprentices.

Clear amber gold body topped by a medium thick sustaining head with good lace.  Somewhat sweet yet bitter aroma with piney and peppery notes.  Sweet and bitter hop flavor with a good malt balance with piney notes and a bitter hoppy finish with a touch of pepper.  Light to medium bodied and smooth.
The Best Lager I have ever had.  Must be drank within 3 months of production
About as good as this style gets. Nice golden color. Rich malt for the style, caramel and toffee present, quite flavorful. Moderately hoppy and perfectly smooth. A nice surpise.
Light yellow liquid.  Nice head.  Good strong flavor.  Good carbonation.  Nice full flavor with hints of sweetness.  A good beer, just not all that special.
This is an outstanding lager.  One that puts faith back into the lagers.  Great bright clear gold with a nice head.  Flavor is sweet and finishes with a little hop to it.
Nice clear color and fresh aroma.  Like a thick pilsner taste, with a touch of honey.  Very very drinkable.
user_location: Middle of no where, Ohio, USA

text: This was one great beer.  As has been said, this is extremely well balanced--a beautiful combination of malt and hops.  The palate is smooth and the flavor is great.  A wonderful beer that could be consumed quite regularly.

Extremely well balanced and tasty - especially for a lager.  Nice malty flavor with a decent balance of hops.  A nice fruity sour apple finish.  It would be a nice intorductory beer for thos who only drink macros.
Indeed a good beer. A little too bitter for my taste, and it feels also somewhat similiar to Budweiser. Its not golden in its colour as I expected, it is more like amber.
This is a wonderful tasting and looking beer.  It is so smooth and enjoyable.  Perfect blend of flavors and bitterness.  So far I have to say this is my favorite of the Great Lakes beers.
This is a very very good beer.  It's Malty with a twinge of citrus.  This is my favorite of the Great lakes brews.

UPDATED: DEC 23, 2003 Malty aroma with some citrus in the background. Perfect golden color. Foamy but diminishing white head.  Tangy front. Spicy hops give way to a slowly rising malt presence. Clean , dry finish. A crisp bite from the carbonation at lower temperatures mellows as the beer warms. Start to finish one of the finest lagers in the world. A must for both fans of this style and for those who have written off pale lager styles.

UPDATED: MAR 15, 2009 Wow.  A brilliant sparkling gold color.  A sensuous head of lofting beauty. Definite orange/citrus aroma flavor with just bite of bitterness from the hops.  Finishes dry, yet leaves your mouth watering for more.  One of the best beers brewed in the world.
Medium golden colored with a full head.  Good spice and hop profile makes this very authentic tasting.  True to style and quite drinkable.
This beer is an excellent combination of the bread-like European malts and spicy noble hops. An excellent session brew that leaves you thirsty for more beer.

I drink so few lagers these days that this beer seemed boring.  Let's see, orange-straw colored with little head.  The lacing was nice on this one, though.  Definte honey in the aroma, with hints of peach and maybe orange.  Taste is just too smooth (like I said, lot's of ales) with a slightly sweet medium mouthfeel.  A bit of bitterness grabs you just as you swallow, but nothing to speak of.  This is a very drinkable beer, and I would try it again.  I would definately like to find it on tap.
Not too bad of a beer.  Boring orange hue.  Nice palate, but nothing too special.  aroma is pleasent, but has not lasting mark.

A great beer, even better on tap.  This is a fairly unique flavored beer, not many ive tried are anything like it.  It takes a little getting used to, in fact i really disliked it the first time I tried it, but it grows on you.

Clear, warm golden body, moderately carbonated.  Aroma is doughy, lots of crystal malt, honey, and herbal European hops.  I find this to be quite similar to certain APAs; caramel malt balanced by a piney bitterness.  Very enjoyable.

An exceptional offering from the Great Lakes Brewing Co. in Cleveland. One of my favorite road drinks and is one of the first items Ill scope out when I visit Cleveland. Like the Vienna Amber (Eliot Ness) from Great Lakes Brewing, the Dortmunder Gold is an excellent draught specialty, which sadly Ive yet to find west of the Rockies.

The Great Lakes Dortmunder is my personal favorite in this style of brew and is one of the easiest drinking (bitter) beers around. Ive found it to be extremely enjoyable on its own, with appetizers, and even with a meal, particularly fish dishes such as halibut or grilled prawns. 

If youre looking for a nice medium bodied brew, dont hesitate to tackle this one, particularly if youre looking for something with a little more bang than a simple pilsner.
While certainly a craft brew, this amazingly tame style just sort of sits there on the table.  It has nothing interesting to say.  It just sits and listens.   30 I.B.U.s and simple caramel matiness.
Good beer. Strong malt backbone with enough hop to make it crisp and easy drinking. Sweet aroma and flavor, maybe even a hint of honey.
Excellent lager. Great Lakes does it again. Great dry taste smooth mildly hoppy finish.

Delicious Germanic-spirited beer that comes from such a dismal place like Cleveland! 
THis is far from dismal fortunately as are most of Great Lakes beers ..
They seem to be having success across most of the board.  
This one is really nice alone or with light German food id say .
Im on the West coast of Canada at the moment and cannot find any Great Lakes for sale here, as they seem to keep most of the American micros out of the liquor stores. I intend on getting some when im back in States .
Party on !

Rerate: After finding it on tap I have to raise my rating a bit.  This beer is very well rounded.  Its one of those brews youd like to have if you were stranded on some island. Very refreshing, but somehow not lacking in complexity. 
A great Ohio brew. My personal favorite when back in the heartland.
UPDATED: AUG 1, 2003 Lovely on tap- with a dry taste, but smooth finish.  Clean, and malty, mild but prominent hops.  I like this one.  Impressive beer for a style that originated somewhere else.
Lagers suck. With that said, this is one of the better ones. Not as good as Pilsner Urkwell, but crisp and easy drinking.
mmmmm....good stuff.  Excellent color for a beer, with a nice bold taste.  Im always in the mood for one of these.
Not a big fan of the style, but indeed a pretty good beer.  Fairly light on the palate, with spicy, floral hops barely coming through.  Slightly malty witha fairly clean, but distinct finish.
This has become my favorite lager.  Perfect balance between hops and malt.  Gold color, decent head.  Great hop aroma.  Very clean, yet flavorful for a lager.

I am helpless before good Dortmunder and this is one of the finest.  Great big fluffy head over wonderful clear gold.  Generous light malt with complex hop interplay, yielding to a sharper finish than other Dorts Ive tried.  Very like Dominion and Victory, but a bit sharper and a measure more tart.  Brilliant.  PsychProf is to thank for this beauty.
Totally out of wack diacetyl thing going on here. Butter flavored through and through, with a slight hop bitterness and a touch of sweetness.
This brew is VERY smooth.  It goes down much too easy.  This is what those "Macro" american lagers should strive for:  flavor and body.
Interesting dortmunder style brew.  Nice hops.
Great example of a unique style!

Honey colored pour with a quickly disappearing white head. Malty nose that has an almost delicate quality to it. Thin to medium body that qualifys this as an everyday/session beer for me. Excellent balance and flavor. Top notch brew, only wish I could get this in California.Thanks to hopsrus for this one.
Good, clean, balanced lager.  I like.
Draft:  Very nice offering. My first from Great Lakes Brewery, but based upon this beer, it wont be my last.
This lager is light with barely any trace of hops.  Very smooth taste that makes for easy drinking.

A nose of fresh baked bread and a beautiful golden color lead to a lager that is gentle, round, soft, and light on the palate with a finish that is semi-bitter at the throat.   Nice session beer.   I could drink 50 of these!   OK, in two days!

Very malty, not really "hardwater" enough for the style, but damn good beer, one of the better American lagers thats regularly produced...Michael Jackson says that the heariest Dortmunders come from the US these days, but...the only other one Ive tried recently was Goose Islands, what else is there?
moderate golden with no head, didnt detect much out of the aroma other than a little maltiness, flavor was slightly buttery
The hops are oxidized and the malt is too bright and its too effervescent to be a dortmunder but its good and its easy drinking.
Light yellow. Effervescent. Grainy. Medium maltiness. Some bitterness, flavor hops in the background.

For stuff that is found in my grocery store, this stuff is excellent. Has an aroma reminiscent of the cantillon iris i had not too long ago... call me crazy, but it does. great, almost excellent interplay between the malt and the hops... very satisfying. god bless cleveland

A fantastic golden color, beautiful aroma, and great taste.  The only things lacking are the head and the finish.  The finish is not short, but could be a bit longer.  This, however, does not take away from the experience at all.  A fantastic beer.
I love the freshly baked bread maltiness of this beer and its even hop definition.  Just a nice, gently crisp brew.

Golden amber color.   Very thin head that dissapeared rather quickly.  Aroma is definitely floral (Cascades) and some malt comes through as well.  I know they use Cascades along with Hallertau hops, I just would like the Hallertaus to be a little more prevalent.  Its alright but not something Id go out of my way for.

UPDATED: AUG 13, 2005 A most perfect time to revisit this old favorite of the style.  Bread, English hop, toast, and fruit are evenly distributed throughout this clean and, almost, boastful aroma.  Dough and brown sugar provide a sweetness that suffices to be a dessert beer.  Yet quenching enough to be a session beer and hoppy enough to arouse an appetitie.  Medium carbonation and redidual caramel sweetness combine to provide a perfect feel.  I wish Dortmunders were more readily available.  This is best in its class thus far.  Gulpener Dort comes in a close second.

I liked it... A good european style beer.

This stands as one of the few lagers I truly enjoy.  Well-balanced and thirst quenching, this is an excellent session beer.  Try this during the summer while working outside.   You will not be disappointed!

Bottle.  The classic golden lager color.  I can actually get a nice aroma from this beer.  The flavor is a bit tangy, dry, a quick hop bite.  There is an essence of fruit in the aroma which I could not pick up when tasted.  On the whole nicely balanced and enjoyable to drink, but nothing stands out.

This beer poured nice dark golden color, forming a nice light head that left a wonderful lace after subsiding. An slight aroma of hops and citrus. It had a slightly tangy flavor from the hops that seems to give it a good finish. Decent body for this style. Worth trying.
Good. Very good. Light and dryer in the appropriate fashion.
A bit bitter, too dry and crisp for my taste.

UPDATED: SEP 15, 2004 A stand-by, go-to, brew for me, when I don't find anything else intersting and i just feel like drinking.  Nice and thick, slightly toasty malts, the hops actually keep up and keep the whole thing nicely balanced.  A true winner.

Had the draft version at the Renaissance in downtown Cleveland. Once again, Great Lakes can do no wrong in my book. Wonderful effervescence on the pour, and a nice off-white head. The lacing was what really impressed me though. Similar to how you can tell how old a tree is by counting the rings, the lacing allowed you to see the previous level where your beer was before each sip. So by the end I had a nice ripple effect down the entire length of the inside of my glass. I have never seen that before and it was very cool. As for the flavor, very good as well. Malty oat flavor. Another winner from GLBC.
I love Great lakes beer!  I am amazed everytime I have one - they are always excellent!
A very good beer.  I am  a big fan of great lakes and I have to say theyve done it again.  It is very robust yet has some complicated flavors that make it interesting.  A great choice.
A very good lager!!! satisfying and refresing.

A little too bitter for me.  Also a very strong hops aftertaste.  I think this beer was a little overrated.  It is descent, but not really anything special.  An above average lager that tastes a lot like an ale.

A lot more here than i expected, and like someone else mentioned it is very ale-like.  Hoppy, creamy head, a dark golden color.  Floral and citrusy notes, like many ales.  A lot of good malt body that made this beer feel very solid and enjoyable.

thinking this would be a vapid, washed out demi-lager, i was surprised to see a saute-pan copper pouring with a thin but pretty head that anxiously swells with a light swirl. a bread and jam aroma is enticing if not riveting. a soft palate, perfect balance. not a huge flavor, but a mighty big little beer.
Possibly the best lager (though Im not a lager fan) I have ever had. Crisp and satisfying and very well-balanced.

UPDATED: JAN 26, 2005 Grade update Jan. 05:

As good as a traditional lager might expect to be (basically German as done by an American microbrewery), but its a far, far cry from perfection once youve tasted a great Imperial IPA or American Strong Ale, not to name any names.  I may have to start downgrading a bunch of beers Ive already rated, now that they simply pale in comparison to the Best.  Between 3 (just above average) and 3.5 (pretty solid stuff).

Pleasantly thick malty aroma and flavor.  Good solid hopping.  This is a very nice lager.  There is a very nice fresh mown hay quality in this beer.  I would love the opportunity for this to be my lawnmowing beer. Thanks PsychProf!

UPDATED: NOV 15, 2003 (Re-rate)Deep golden. Nice white head. Slightly toasted and loaded with german malts. The body is fantasticly full, rich and almost thick with a  luscious, rich malt profile with hints of toast and caramel. Rounded out nicely by what seems to be a mix of saaz and hallertau hops. Dripping with flavor and depth. Very crisp and refreshing, possesing superb balance. One of the best lagers I ever had.

Most impressive. Huge head, multilayered, with the big bubbles around the side forcing the compact central head to contract. Or is that my pinhead at the end of a grueling term? Anyway, toasty, malty, excellent aroma, a touch of maybe Saaz. Most folks here say full-bodied, and I agree...for a lager this is exceptionally well-built. Crisp. I have to let it warm and see if it retains that flavor and crispness, as VENOM claims.

text: Excellent - the best loved Great Lakes brew in Cleveland, Dortmunder Gold takes this obscure style to a new level.  Very drinkable and immediately satisfying, it serves as Great Lakes flagship beer.
Light golden color.  Light everything.  Light, fruity hop nose.  Faint fruity hop tastes.  Okay.
I like the name of their pale ale better, but this is a superb beer.

Wow!!  My bell has been rung!  The folks at Great Lakes Brewing arent taking any prisoners.  I cant believe something this good is coming out of Cleveland.   
This well crafted brew could quickly become habit forming.   This brew pours a medium
hazy amber with a small amount of body particles.  The huge frothy bone colored head is
fully lasting and has excellent lacing - in a word; outstanding.  The aroma is very fresh. 
The nose is moderately malty with hints of sweet cereal, ultralight in the hop department,
and lightly yeasty with hints of soap.  There was a nice balance
between the three - in a word stellar.    The flavor is unbelievably balanced; moderately sweet and bitter
initially with a moderately sweet and bitter finish of longish duration.  The palate is perfect
with medium to full body, creamy soft texture, and a clean dry astringency to the finish.  This
beer has body, if you cant feel it, youre spending too much time looking at the glass.  I
keep thinking little sips, little sips because of the cost - but I feel myself deeply desiring
to quaff this beer.  I finally have an accurate understanding of the word imbibe.   Think
liquid crack but cheaper.  Drink at your own risk!!!

Not their best but not awful either. Im a huge lager fan and this stuff isnt cheap enough to drink while cooking bratwurst, but not good enough to drink alone. Ive bought it in the past, and may well buy it again, but there are other brews at better prices i prefer. Full bodied lager that has little head, light finish, feels weird drinking it on a Summers da,y but not right ofr winter either.... February 29th beer maybe?
Really liked this lager.  Distinct but good flavor, a lot different than most beers, good for a change.
Deep golden. Herbal nose, big malty body. Complex, with loads of different flavours.

A very nice beer. Flavorful, hoppy-ish, I could drink this over and over again. I am starting to realize I like the Great Lakes Brewing Co. I wrote that on 4/27/01 with a 3.8 rating... Im increasing my rating. This is a very good beer.

I really enjoyed this American effort at a European style. Very malty, but with an oaty-graininess that keeps it in check. Well-balanced and dry towards the end. Emminently quaffable, even compulsively so.  Thanks Trappist Ales Rule, another winner from Great Lakes!

Healthy head with a nice apricot color. Wonderful aroma. Friendly to the palate. Very well balanced and tasty. Seemed a little overly carbonated in the finish, but at least it was clean. Overall, a rather enjoyable and easy-to-drink brew... yet another great Great Lakes beer.
A well made example of the style. Enjoyed it on the premises in Cleveland

A nice Dortmunder lager but Ive never been one to jump on the bandwagon of Great Lakes just for the sake of jumping. While its true their beers offer good fresh flavor, I prefer the Select Lager from Great Lakes crosstown rival Crooked River. Dortmunder Gold has a good balance of malt and hops and is enjoyable in every way...but is it really worth the higher price? Once they passed the $7.00 mark for a 6-pack I think they started thinking more of their product than they have the right to.
Really good lager.  I usually dont care much for lagers, but this one is outstanding.
Nice smooth creamy mouthfeel. A Great lager. Strong hop and malt presence. Yum!

it looks like a plain lage but is much more complex.
very smooth and hasa nice hop/malt balance.
yet another great beer from the folks at great lakes.

Holy Cow!  A friend and I powered through a six of this while playing music in the backyard and sure wished we had more.  Ive definitely used the word balanced cavalierly in earlier reviews because this brew defines the word - both a generous malt and a strong hoppy presence - and such a great feel in the mouth.  By far the best lager Ive ever had.

UPDATED: MAR 1, 2003 A great beer from one of the best american breweries. They know how to make one hell of a beer over at the great lakes brewery. This has a robust solid flavor to it. It is smooth without being weak. An great beer. Very cool how they managed to balance the malts and hops to come out with a very smooth brew.

Whereas i didnt care as much for the Eliot Ness, i could drink this one all day. Excellent balance, tasty malt flavor, and nice hop finish. Very easy to drink and went great with dinner. Great aroma and fairly long lasting head. Great beer.
Rich golden colour; hugely malty, toasty, caramel nose & palate; very big & chewy for the style.  Finishes smooth
My first Dortmunder so I dont have much comparison. A nice hoppy lager though. Nothing too special, but certaintly not a bad everyday beer.
Wonderful.  Gold Rocks.
Great looking beer; fine, long-lasting head, beautiful amber color.  I put this in a class with some other great beers - Sam Adams Boston Lager and Crooked River ESB.
Majorly dissapointing, not good at all

A decent Lager, but nothing special.  I tried it at a bar and after one decided to settle for Heinekkens after that.  The bar did not have much of a selection.  This is not in the same class as Great Lakes Burning River brew which is outstanding.
